  • CVE-2024-4761 (pending score) Google Chromium V8 Out-of-Bounds Memory Write Vulnerability
  • CVE-2021-40655 (7.5 high) D-Link DIR-605 Router Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2014-100005 (CVSS*v2* 6.8 medium) D-Link DIR-600 Router Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) Vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-4671
(9.7 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.17%

updated 2024-05-24T19:21:23

6 posts

Use after free in Visuals in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.201 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to potentially perform a sandbox escape via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-05-20T19:17:23.683Z ##

Zero Day Engineering: Google Chrome "actively exploited" bug chain on Viz & v8-wasm (May 2024)
Alisa Esage provides root cause analyses for both CVE-2024-4671 (Use after free in Visuals, disclosed 09 May 2024, added to CISA KEV on 13 May) and CVE-2024-4761 (Out of bounds write in V8 allowing for RCE, disclosed 13 May 2024, added to KEV on 16 May). These were both exploited zero-days at the time of their disclosure.

h/t: @gnyman

#CVE_2024_4671 #CVE_2024_4761 #Chrome #Google #zeroday #CVE #vulnerability

##
gnyman at 2024-05-20T06:57:14.944Z ##

Chrome zero-day analysis: Security researcher Alisa Esage has published root cause analysis for two of the three Chrome zero-days that Google patched last week—CVE-2024-4761 and CVE-2024-4671 (yes, very confusing CVEs).
risky-biz

Every time I see a #Chrome RCE I loose a bit more hope.

In my book, Chrome was the new browser which was built "secure by design". Giving up on all the legacy crap which made it possible to get compromised by just visiting a website.

But here we are, where Alisa Esage states

Based on my evaluation, the exploit can be recreated in about a week by someone with good knowledge and experience in Chrome exploitation, so it's definitely worth updating Chrome-based infrastructures as soon as possible.

Both bugs seem to be possible because Chrome is c++ though? So maybe #rustlang is the saviour who will finally free us from this.

##
nathans at 2024-05-16T18:06:02.842Z ##

One more reason to not use Chrome!

Google fixes third actively exploited Chrome zero-day in a week

Google has released a new emergency Chrome security update to address the third zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks within a week.

"Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild," the search giant said in a security advisory published on Wednesday.

The high-severity zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2024-4947) is caused by a type confusion weakness in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine reported by Kaspersky's Vasily Berdnikov and Boris Larin.

Although such flaws generally enable threat actors to trigger browser crashes by reading or writing memory out of buffer bounds, they can also exploit them for arbitrary code execution on targeted devices.

The other two actively exploited Chrome zero-days patched this week are CVE-2024-4671 (a use-after-free flaw in the Visuals component) and CVE-2024-4761 (an out-of-bounds write bug in the V8 JavaScript engine)

#News #Security #CyberSecurity #Tech #Google #Chrome #ZeroDay

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/google/google-fixes-CVE-2024-4947-third-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-in-a-week/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T19:17:23.000Z ##

Zero Day Engineering: Google Chrome "actively exploited" bug chain on Viz & v8-wasm (May 2024)
Alisa Esage provides root cause analyses for both CVE-2024-4671 (Use after free in Visuals, disclosed 09 May 2024, added to CISA KEV on 13 May) and CVE-2024-4761 (Out of bounds write in V8 allowing for RCE, disclosed 13 May 2024, added to KEV on 16 May). These were both exploited zero-days at the time of their disclosure.

h/t: @gnyman

#CVE_2024_4671 #CVE_2024_4761 #Chrome #Google #zeroday #CVE #vulnerability

##
nathans@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-16T18:06:02.000Z ##

One more reason to not use Chrome!

Google fixes third actively exploited Chrome zero-day in a week

Google has released a new emergency Chrome security update to address the third zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks within a week.

"Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild," the search giant said in a security advisory published on Wednesday.

The high-severity zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2024-4947) is caused by a type confusion weakness in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine reported by Kaspersky's Vasily Berdnikov and Boris Larin.

Although such flaws generally enable threat actors to trigger browser crashes by reading or writing memory out of buffer bounds, they can also exploit them for arbitrary code execution on targeted devices.

The other two actively exploited Chrome zero-days patched this week are CVE-2024-4671 (a use-after-free flaw in the Visuals component) and CVE-2024-4761 (an out-of-bounds write bug in the V8 JavaScript engine)

#News #Security #CyberSecurity #Tech #Google #Chrome #ZeroDay

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/google/google-fixes-CVE-2024-4947-third-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-in-a-week/

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-14T13:23:23.000Z ##

I feel the need to point out that with this update, Opera went to Chromium "124.0.6367.62"… yes you read that right ".62" which is a build long before both recent 0-day exploits (it is from last month).

To be clear, Opera is not faster at responding to the CVE-2024-4761 0-day than Edge or Brave (or Chrome and Vivaldi obviously), it is much, much slower. Unless they have backported security fixes and their Changelog gives no indication of that https://blogs.opera.com/desktop/changelog-for-110/ , they are missing all of the following security improvements

• High CVE-2024-4761: Out of bounds write in V8 [0-day exploit in the wild]
• High CVE-2024-4671: Use after free in Visuals [0-day exploit in the wild]
• High CVE-2024-4558: Use after free in ANGLE
• High CVE-2024-4559: Heap buffer overflow in WebAudio
• High CVE-2024-4331: Use after free in Picture In Picture
• High CVE-2024-4368: Use after free in Dawn
• Critical CVE-2024-4058: Type Confusion in ANGLE
• High CVE-2024-4059: Out of bounds read in V8 API
• High CVE-2024-4060: Use after free in Dawn

#CVE_2024_4761 #CVE_2024_4671 #Chrome #OperaBrowser #OperaWebBrowser #ZeroDay

CVE-2024-5273
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-24T18:52:11

2 posts

Jenkins Report Info Plugin 1.2 and earlier does not perform path validation of the workspace directory while serving report files. Additionally, Report Info Plugin does not support distributed builds. This results in a path traversal vulnerability, allowing attackers with Item/Configure permission to retrieve Surefire failures, PMD violations, Findbugs bugs, and Checkstyle errors on the controll

  • CVE-2024-28793 (8.0 high) Stored XSS vulnerability in Team Concert Git Plugin
  • XXE vulnerabilities in OpenText Application Automation Tools Plugin
    • CVE-2024-4189 (7.1 high) LrScriptResultsParser.java
    • CVE-2024-4184 (7.1 high) XpathReader.java
    • CVE-2024-4690 (7.1 high) others

    • CVE-2024-4211 (4.3 medium) ALM jobs configurations
    • CVE-2024-4691 (4.3 medium) ALM Octane configurations
    • CVE-2024-4692 (4.3 medium) Service Virtualization configurations
  • CVE-2024-5273 (4.3 medium) Path traversal vulnerability in Report Info Plugin

CVE-2024-4978
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-24T14:15:17.587000

6 posts

Justice AV Solutions Viewer Setup 8.3.7.250-1 contains a malicious binary when executed and is signed with an unexpected authenticode signature. A remote, privileged threat actor may exploit this vulnerability to execute of unauthorized PowerShell commands.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-24T13:45:04.000Z ##

JAVS Courtroom Audio-Visual Software Installer Serves Backdoor https://www.securityweek.com/javs-courtroom-audio-visual-software-installer-serves-backdoor/ #Malware&Threats #Vulnerabilities #CVE20244978 #ICS/OT #Rapid7 #JAVS

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-24T13:45:03.000Z ##

JAVS Courtroom Audio-Visual Software Installer Serves Backdoor https://www.securityweek.com/javs-courtroom-audio-visual-software-installer-serves-backdoor/ #Malware&Threats #Vulnerabilities #CVE20244978 #ICS/OT #Rapid7 #JAVS

##
catc0n at 2024-05-23T14:45:52.957Z ##

In the course of investigating suspicious behavior in an MDR customer environment, Rapid7 discovered an apparent supply chain attack in the form of a backdoored installer being hosted on a legitimate vendor’s website. The vendor, Justice AV Solutions, makes AV software used in (among other things) courtrooms, prisons, and interrogations. Rapid7 MDR has observed C2 callbacks and other post-exploitation behavior related to the backdoored software in multiple customer environments.

Huge shout-out to all the MDR, IR, and vuln research folks who worked to validate and document findings, notify affected MDR customers, and investigate related activity. And an equally huge shout-out to @cisagov for their prompt assistance with disclosure.

The backdoored software was assigned CVE-2024-4978. Full write-up with attacker behavior observations, IOCs, guidance, and vendor statement here: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/05/23/cve-2024-4978-backdoored-justice-av-solutions-viewer-software-used-in-apparent-supply-chain-attack/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-23T13:36:52.078Z ##

Rapid7:CVE-2024-4978: Backdoored Justice AV Solutions Viewer Software Used in Apparent Supply Chain Attack
WAKE UP, NEW BACKDOOR! Rapid7 reports that an installation file of Justice AV Solutions (JAVS) has been backdoored, which delivers GateDoor/Rustdoor malware. JAVS Suite 8 is a portfolio of audio/video recording, viewing, and management software for government organizations and businesses. This is being tracked as CVE-2024-4978 (CVSSv4 8.7 high, CVSSv3 8.4, disclosed 22 May 2024 by CISA on behalf of Rapid7). They described observed attacker behavior, an exploitation timeline, and IOC.

fffmpeg.exe persistently communicates with a C2 server using Windows sockets and WinHTTP requests ... Malicious PowerShell scripts will attempt to bypass the Anti-Malware Scan Interface (AMSI) and disable Event Tracing for Windows (ETW).

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @todb @mttaggart

#CVE_2024_4978 #backdoor #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #trojan #gatedoor #rustdoor #vulnerability #JusticeAV #threatintel #IOC

Huge shout-out to all the MDR, IR, and vuln research folks who worked to validate and document findings, notify affected MDR customers, and investigate related activity. And an equally huge shout-out to @cisagov for their prompt assistance with disclosure.

jbhall56 at 2024-05-22T12:29:14.374Z ##

CVE-2020-17519
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.15%

updated 2024-05-23T19:54:02.487000

9 posts

A change introduced in Apache Flink 1.11.0 (and released in 1.11.1 and 1.11.2 as well) allows attackers to read any file on the local filesystem of the JobManager through the REST interface of the JobManager process. Access is restricted to files accessible by the JobManager process. All users should upgrade to Flink 1.11.3 or 1.12.0 if their Flink instance(s) are exposed. The issue was fixed in c

screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T12:40:33.171Z ##

@reverseics It looks like the root cause of CVE-2020-17159 is your favorite Common Weakness Enumeration: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') ../../../../etc/passwd
Here is the reporter's vulnerability analysis: https://www.vicarius.io/vsociety/posts/cve-2020-17519-apache-flink-directory-traversal-vulnerability

Unit 42 observed the CVE-2020-17159 exploit in the wild around 21 April 2021: https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/network-attack-trends-winter-2020/

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.31%

updated 2024-05-23T18:30:54

5 posts

NextGen Healthcare Mirth Connect before version 4.4.1 is vulnerable to unauthenticated remote code execution. Note that this vulnerability is caused by the incomplete patch of CVE-2023-37679.

@jgreig CVE-2023-43208 was exploited in the wild since at least 07 March 2024: https://github.com/nextgenhealthcare/connect/discussions/6124

Horizon3 had made it easy for the attacker by providing the proof of concept on 12 January 2024: https://www.horizon3.ai/attack-research/attack-blogs/writeup-for-cve-2023-43208-nextgen-mirth-connect-pre-auth-rce/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-20T16:33:04.843Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

  • CVE-2024-4947 (CVSSv3 score pending, disclosed 15 May 2024 by Google as an exploited zero-day) Google Chromium V8 Type Confusion Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-43208 (9.8 critical, disclosed 26 October 2023 by NextGen) NextGen Healthcare Mirth Connect Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability

Exploitation reports:

  • CVE-2024-4947: 15 May 2024 "Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild."
  • CVE-2023-43208: 07 March 2024 "It seems we were attacked by this vulnerability in Mirth Connect Server"

#CVE_2024_4947 #CVE_2023_43208 #eitw #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE #activeexploitation #vulnerability #zeroday #Chrome #Mirth #NextGen #MirthConnect

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-22T20:04:26.000Z ##

@jgreig CVE-2023-43208 was exploited in the wild since at least 07 March 2024: https://github.com/nextgenhealthcare/connect/discussions/6124

Horizon3 had made it easy for the attacker by providing the proof of concept on 12 January 2024: https://www.horizon3.ai/attack-research/attack-blogs/writeup-for-cve-2023-43208-nextgen-mirth-connect-pre-auth-rce/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T16:33:04.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

  • CVE-2024-4947 (CVSSv3 score pending, disclosed 15 May 2024 by Google as an exploited zero-day) Google Chromium V8 Type Confusion Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-43208 (9.8 critical, disclosed 26 October 2023 by NextGen) NextGen Healthcare Mirth Connect Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability

Exploitation reports:

  • CVE-2024-4947: 15 May 2024 "Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild."
  • CVE-2023-43208: 07 March 2024 "It seems we were attacked by this vulnerability in Mirth Connect Server"

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put
  • FG-IR-23-433 CVE-2023-50180 (5.5 medium) Exposure of password hashes to read-only admin
  • FG-IR-23-137 Format String Bug in cli command
    • CVE-2023-36640 (6.7 medium)
    • CVE-2023-45583 (6.7 medium)
  • FG-IR-23-465 CVE-2024-23664 (6.1 medium) FortiAuthenticator - Open Redirect on /portal/disclaimer

    • CVE-2024-27316 for Apache HTTP Server (httpd)
    • CVE-2024-24549 for Apache Tomcat
    • CVE-2024-30255 for Envoy proxy (nghttp2)
    • CVE-2023-45288 for Golang
    • CVE-2024-28182 for nghttp2
    • CVE-2024-27983 for Node.js
    • CVE-2024-3302 for Firefox
  • FG-IR-23-282 CVE-2023-40720 (7.1 high) IDOR over SIP configuration file
  • FG-IR-24-052 CVE-2024-31493 (6.5 medium) Information disclosure in content hub
  • FG-IR-23-222 Multiple improper input validation and authorization vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-23667 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23668 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23669 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23670 (8.8 high)

  • FG-IR-23-191 CVE-2024-23107 (5.5 medium) Read only administrator can see passwords' hashes
  • FG-IR-24-054 CVE-2024-31491 (8.8 high) Readonly user could execute sensitive operations
  • FG-IR-23-225 CVE-2023-45586 (5.0 medium) SSL-VPN user IP spoofing
  • FG-IR-24-040 CVE-2024-31488 (6.8 medium) Stored and reflected XSS
  • FG-IR-23-474 CVE-2024-23665 (5.9 medium) Unauthorized ADOM operations

CVE-2024-4947
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.28%

updated 2024-05-23T15:30:39

22 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.60 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-05-21T13:33:51.238Z ##

buptsb: CVE-2024-4947: v8 incorrect AccessInfo for module namespace object causes Maglev type confusion
buptsb and mistymntncop provide a proof of concept and root cause analysis for the actively exploited Google Chrome zero-day CVE-2024-4947, which is a type confusion vulnerability in V8. See parent toot above. h/t: @jullrich

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

  • CVE-2024-4947 (CVSSv3 score pending, disclosed 15 May 2024 by Google as an exploited zero-day) Google Chromium V8 Type Confusion Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-43208 (9.8 critical, disclosed 26 October 2023 by NextGen) NextGen Healthcare Mirth Connect Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability

Exploitation reports:

  • CVE-2024-4947: 15 May 2024 "Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild."
  • CVE-2023-43208: 07 March 2024 "It seems we were attacked by this vulnerability in Mirth Connect Server"

##
topher@infosec.space at 2024-05-20T13:56:04.000Z ##

So are they just straight up not updating it?

CVE-2024-4947: Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.60 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

CVE-2024-4761: Out of bounds write in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.207 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

And #LinuxMint is still at 124.0.6367.201

http://packages.linuxmint.com/search.php?release=any&section=any&keyword=chromium

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-17T12:46:59.103Z ##

@browserversiontracker @ruario
For context, Microsoft Edge was updated against the 4 Chromium vulnerabilities patched Wednesday night:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4947 Type Confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild.
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4948 Use after free in Dawn
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4949 Use after free in V8
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4950 Inappropriate implementation in Downloads

Release notes for Microsoft Edge Security Updates:

Microsoft has a fix for CVE-2024-4947 to Microsoft Edge Stable Channel (Version 124.0.2478.109) and Extended Stable channel (Version 124.0.2478.109), which has been reported by the Chromium team as having an exploit in the wild.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-17T02:29:42.089Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) put out several Chromium security advisories:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4947 Type Confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild.
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4948 Use after free in Dawn
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4949 Use after free in V8
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4950 Inappropriate implementation in Downloads

The vulnerabilities are in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable.

Moreover, according to the Release notes for Microsoft Edge Security Updates:

Microsoft has a fix for CVE-2024-4947 to Microsoft Edge Stable Channel (Version 124.0.2478.109) and Extended Stable channel (Version 124.0.2478.109), which has been reported by the Chromium team as having an exploit in the wild.

See parent toot above for original source. cc: @ruario

#CVE_2024_4947 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #Chrome #Chromium #MSRC #Microsoft #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4948 #CVE_2024_4949 #CVE_2024_4950

##
nathans at 2024-05-16T18:06:02.842Z ##

One more reason to not use Chrome!

Google fixes third actively exploited Chrome zero-day in a week

Google has released a new emergency Chrome security update to address the third zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks within a week.

"Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild," the search giant said in a security advisory published on Wednesday.

The high-severity zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2024-4947) is caused by a type confusion weakness in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine reported by Kaspersky's Vasily Berdnikov and Boris Larin.

Although such flaws generally enable threat actors to trigger browser crashes by reading or writing memory out of buffer bounds, they can also exploit them for arbitrary code execution on targeted devices.

The other two actively exploited Chrome zero-days patched this week are CVE-2024-4671 (a use-after-free flaw in the Visuals component) and CVE-2024-4761 (an out-of-bounds write bug in the V8 JavaScript engine)

#News #Security #CyberSecurity #Tech #Google #Chrome #ZeroDay

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/google/google-fixes-CVE-2024-4947-third-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-in-a-week/

##
avoidthehack at 2024-05-16T17:44:03.595Z ##

Google fixes third actively exploited #Chrome zero-day in a week

Geez, #Google has pushed a #security fix for yet another zero-day exploited in the wild. Separate from the other two (tracked as CVE-2024-4947), it’s a type confusion weakness in the V8 JavaScript engine.

It affects all #Chromium based browsers. Forks (Vivaldi, Brave, Edge) should be rolling out updates. Again… so, as usual, update ASAP.

#browsers #infosec #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/google/google-fixes-CVE-2024-4947-third-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-in-a-week/

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4948 Use after free in Dawn
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4949 Use after free in V8
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4950 Inappropriate implementation in Downloads

##
nathans@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-16T18:06:02.000Z ##

One more reason to not use Chrome!

Google fixes third actively exploited Chrome zero-day in a week

Google has released a new emergency Chrome security update to address the third zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks within a week.

"Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild," the search giant said in a security advisory published on Wednesday.

The high-severity zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2024-4947) is caused by a type confusion weakness in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine reported by Kaspersky's Vasily Berdnikov and Boris Larin.

Although such flaws generally enable threat actors to trigger browser crashes by reading or writing memory out of buffer bounds, they can also exploit them for arbitrary code execution on targeted devices.

The other two actively exploited Chrome zero-days patched this week are CVE-2024-4671 (a use-after-free flaw in the Visuals component) and CVE-2024-4761 (an out-of-bounds write bug in the V8 JavaScript engine)

#News #Security #CyberSecurity #Tech #Google #Chrome #ZeroDay

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/google/google-fixes-CVE-2024-4947-third-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-in-a-week/

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-16T17:44:03.000Z ##

Google fixes third actively exploited #Chrome zero-day in a week

Geez, #Google has pushed a #security fix for yet another zero-day exploited in the wild. Separate from the other two (tracked as CVE-2024-4947), it’s a type confusion weakness in the V8 JavaScript engine.

It affects all #Chromium based browsers. Forks (Vivaldi, Brave, Edge) should be rolling out updates. Again… so, as usual, update ASAP.

#browsers #infosec #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/google/google-fixes-CVE-2024-4947-third-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-in-a-week/

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-05-16T11:10:05.000Z ##

Google fixes third actively exploited Chrome zero-day in a week

​Google has released a new emergency Chrome security update to address the third zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks within a week.

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/google/google-fixes-CVE-2024-4947-third-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-in-a-week/

##
mnordhoff@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-16T08:18:06.000Z ##

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/05/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_15.html

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild.

What is this, 3 Chrome 0-days in like 2 weeks?

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T23:29:24.000Z ##

Microsoft: Release notes for Microsoft Edge Security Updates
Microsoft doesn't mention the CVE by name, but they're talking about CVE-2024-4947:

May 15, 2024 Microsoft is aware of the recent exploits existing in the wild. We are actively working on releasing a security fix.

cc: @ligniform

#zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #chrome #chromium #microsoft #CVE_2024_4947

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T23:12:02.000Z ##

@ligniform I agree in part, disagree in part. The exploited vulnerabilities in V8 JavaScript engine have only been documented in Chromium based browsers like Edge, Opera, Vivaldi, Brave, etc.

LibwebP was a rare case last year that Google incorrectly limited the vulnerability's scope to only identify Google Chrome when in reality it impacted plenty of downstream libraries and apps.

Expect to see a Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisory probably tomorrow for CVE-2024-4947.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T21:31:36.000Z ##

Google Chrome zero-day: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Yo wtf. ANOTHER Google Chrome zero day. 9 vulnerabilities fixed, 4 externally reported. CVE-2024-4947 is a Type Confusion in V8 that was reported by Kaspersky researchers.

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild.

h/t @ruario https://social.vivaldi.net/@ruario/112447192279329412
cc: @briankrebs @campuscodi @jwarminsky @serghei

#zeroday #eitw #CVE_2024_4947 #activeexploitation #chrome #google

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-15T21:20:03.000Z ##

Includes a security fix to resolve “CVE-2024-4947: Type Confusion in V8”, an exploit for which exists in the wild.

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-15T21:19:47.000Z ##

• Vivaldi: 6.7.3329.31
• Chrome: 125.0.6422.60
• Chrome ESR: 124.0.6367.221

All of these include a security fix to resolve “CVE-2024-4947: Type Confusion in V8”, an exploit for which exists in the wild.

[Vivaldi is not listed 🆕 in the proceeding post because we actually published earlier in the day. While the 0-day was not mentioned then, we did already have that fix from the time we first released the build]

#CVE_2024_4947 #Chrome #VivaldiBrowser #ZeroDay

CVE-2024-22026
(6.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-23T15:17:25.833000

5 posts

A local privilege escalation vulnerability in EPMM before 12.1.0.0 allows an authenticated local user to bypass shell restriction and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance.

CVE-2024-4835
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-23T09:30:29

1 posts

A XSS condition exists within GitLab in versions 15.11 before 16.10.6, 16.11 before 16.11.3, and 17.0 before 17.0.1. By leveraging this condition, an attacker can craft a malicious page to exfiltrate sensitive user information.

rootlinux@rootlinux.ro at 2024-05-26T10:16:31.000Z ##

GitLab a remediat o vulnerabilitate de gravitate ridicată pe care infractorii o puteau exploata pentru a prelua controlul asupra conturilor de utilizator prin atacuri de scripting cross-site (XSS).

Breșa de securitate (identificată ca CVE-2024-4835) este o problemă de XSS în editorul de cod VS (Web IDE) care permite persoanelor periculoase să fure […]

https://rootlinux.ro/defect-mare-la-gitlab-permite-infractorilor-sa-preia-conturi/

CVE-2024-5157
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-22T18:59:20.240000

6 posts

Use after free in Scheduling in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.76 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T17:38:59.578Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

#CVE_2024_5157 #CVE_2024_5158 #CVE_2024_5159 #CVE_2024_5160 #CVE_2024_5274 #vulnerability #CVE #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google ain't catchin me sleepin. They have another patch for 6 vulnerabilities, 4 externally reported, all high severity. No mention of exploitation.

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-21T20:53:11.263Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google ain't catchin me sleepin. They have another patch for 6 vulnerabilities, 4 externally reported, all high severity. No mention of exploitation.

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.

#Google #PatchTuesday #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-21T20:53:11.000Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google ain't catchin me sleepin. They have another patch for 6 vulnerabilities, 4 externally reported, all high severity. No mention of exploitation.

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.

#Google #PatchTuesday #Chrome #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-5160
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-22T18:59:20.240000

6 posts

Heap buffer overflow in Dawn in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.76 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T17:38:59.578Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

#CVE_2024_5157 #CVE_2024_5158 #CVE_2024_5159 #CVE_2024_5160 #CVE_2024_5274 #vulnerability #CVE #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome

updated 2024-05-22T18:59:20.240000

4 posts

A vulnerability in the activation of an access control list (ACL) on Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Software and Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass the protection that is offered by a configured ACL on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to a logic error that occurs when an ACL changes from inactive to active i

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

  • CVE-2024-20261 (5.8 medium) Cisco Firepower Threat Defense Software Encrypted Archive File Policy Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-20239 (8.8 high) Cisco Firepower Management Center Software SQL Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20361 (5.8 medium) Cisco Firepower Management Center Software Object Group Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20355 (5.0 medium) Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance and Firepower Threat Defense Software Authorization Bypass Vulnerability

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_20293 #CVE #CVE_2024_20363 #CVE #CVE_2024_20261 #CVE #CVE_2024_20239 #CVE #CVE_2024_20361 #CVE #CVE_2024_20355

CVE-2023-20239
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-22T18:30:50

2 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Firepower Management Center (FMC) Software could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct SQL injection attacks on an affected system. This vulnerability exists because the web-based management interface does not adequately validate user input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by authenticating to the application

CVE-2024-20361
(5.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-22T18:30:43

4 posts

A vulnerability in the Object Groups for Access Control Lists (ACLs) feature of Cisco Firepower Management Center (FMC) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass configured access controls on managed devices that are running Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software. This vulnerability is due to the incorrect deployment of the Object Groups for ACLs feature from Cisco

CVE-2024-36077
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-22T18:30:42

2 posts

Qlik Sense Enterprise for Windows before 14.187.4 allows a remote attacker to elevate their privilege due to improper validation. The attacker can elevate their privilege to the internal system role, which allows them to execute commands on the server. This affects February 2024 Patch 3 (14.173.3 through 14.173.7), November 2023 Patch 8 (14.159.4 through 14.159.13), August 2023 Patch 13 (14.139.3

screaminggoat at 2024-05-23T19:24:49.515Z ##

Qlik security advisory: High Severity Security fixes for Qlik Sense Enterprise for Windows (CVE-2024-36077)
CVE-2024-36077 (8.8 High, disclosed 20 May 2024 by Qlik) Due to improper input validation, a remote attacker with existing privileges is able to elevate them to the internal system role, which in turns allows them to execute commands on the server.

no reports of it being maliciously exploited have been received.

#Qlik #vulnerability #CVE_2024_36077 #QlikSense #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-23T19:24:49.000Z ##

Qlik security advisory: High Severity Security fixes for Qlik Sense Enterprise for Windows (CVE-2024-36077)
CVE-2024-36077 (8.8 High, disclosed 20 May 2024 by Qlik) Due to improper input validation, a remote attacker with existing privileges is able to elevate them to the internal system role, which in turns allows them to execute commands on the server.

no reports of it being maliciously exploited have been received.

##

CVE-2024-22275
(4.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-22T12:46:53.887000

4 posts

The vCenter Server contains a partial file read vulnerability. A malicious actor with administrative privileges on the vCenter appliance shell may exploit this issue to partially read arbitrary files containing sensitive data.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-22T14:53:33.066Z ##

VMware security advisory: VMSA-2024-0011:VMware ESXi, Workstation, Fusion and vCenter Server updates address multiple security vulnerabilities
VMware ESXi, Workstation, Fusion and vCenter Server updates address multiple security vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-22273, CVE-2024-22274, CVE-2024-22275) No mention of exploitation. h/t: @jgreig

  • CVE-2024-22273 (8.1 high) out-of-bounds read/write
  • CVE-2024-22274 (7.2 high) VMware vCenter Server authenticated remote-code execution
  • CVE-2024-22275 (4.9 medium) VMware vCenter Server partial file read

#VMware #vulnerability #CVE #ESXi #vCenter #CVE_2024_22273 #CVE_2024_22274 #CVE_2024_22275

CVE-2024-21683(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-22T00:30:39

8 posts

This High severity RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability was introduced in version 5.2 of Confluence Data Center and Server. This RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability, with a CVSS Score of 8.3, allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code which has high impact to confidentiality, high impact to integrity, high impact to availability, and requires no user interaction.  Atla

Nuclei template

##
psytester at 2024-05-24T14:26:53.605Z ##

@heisec
Falsche Zusammenfassung der aktuellen Lücken

Die CVE-2024-21683 mit seiner RCE ist wohl nicht schlimm genug um kritisch zu sein?
Ok, es ist der Admin Endpoint in der App Verwaltung betroffen
/admin/plugins/........
aber die Ausnutzung ist dann sehr simpel.

##
psytester at 2024-05-22T21:42:45.524Z ##

CVE-2024-21683 Atlassian Confluence RCE exploit is already out.
Credit goes to Huong Kieu
https://twitter.com/realalphaman_
and his writeup https://realalphaman.substack.com/p/quick-note-about-cve-2024-21683-authenticated

Fortunately, this is an admin endpoint
/admin/plugins/newcode/addlanguage.action
but payload is really very simple as javascript file content.

CVE-2024-36052(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-21T18:31:33

4 posts

RARLAB WinRAR before 7.00, on Windows, allows attackers to spoof the screen output via ANSI escape sequences, a different issue than CVE-2024-33899.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-22T14:59:27.092Z ##

Siddharth Dushantha: ANSI Escape Injection Vulnerability in WinRAR
Siddharth provides vulnerability details for an ANSI escape sequence injection vulnerability in the console versions of RAR and UnRAR, affecting versions 6.24 and earlier. This vulnerability was patched in version 7.00 on 28 February 2024. Siddharth provides proof of concept for the vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024–33899 for Linux/Unix and CVE-2024–36052 for Windows. h/t: @buherator

#CVE_2024_33899 #CVE_2024_36052 #RAR #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-22273
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-21T18:31:32

4 posts

The storage controllers on VMware ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion have out-of-bounds read/write vulnerability. A malicious actor with access to a virtual machine with storage controllers enabled may exploit this issue to create a denial of service condition or execute code on the hypervisor from a virtual machine in conjunction with other issues.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-22T14:53:33.066Z ##

VMware security advisory: VMSA-2024-0011:VMware ESXi, Workstation, Fusion and vCenter Server updates address multiple security vulnerabilities
VMware ESXi, Workstation, Fusion and vCenter Server updates address multiple security vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-22273, CVE-2024-22274, CVE-2024-22275) No mention of exploitation. h/t: @jgreig

  • CVE-2024-22273 (8.1 high) out-of-bounds read/write
  • CVE-2024-22274 (7.2 high) VMware vCenter Server authenticated remote-code execution
  • CVE-2024-22275 (4.9 medium) VMware vCenter Server partial file read

#VMware #vulnerability #CVE #ESXi #vCenter #CVE_2024_22273 #CVE_2024_22274 #CVE_2024_22275

CVE-2024-22274
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-21T18:31:32

4 posts

The vCenter Server contains an authenticated remote code execution vulnerability. A malicious actor with administrative privileges on the vCenter appliance shell may exploit this issue to run arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-22T14:53:33.066Z ##

VMware security advisory: VMSA-2024-0011:VMware ESXi, Workstation, Fusion and vCenter Server updates address multiple security vulnerabilities
VMware ESXi, Workstation, Fusion and vCenter Server updates address multiple security vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-22273, CVE-2024-22274, CVE-2024-22275) No mention of exploitation. h/t: @jgreig

  • CVE-2024-22273 (8.1 high) out-of-bounds read/write
  • CVE-2024-22274 (7.2 high) VMware vCenter Server authenticated remote-code execution
  • CVE-2024-22275 (4.9 medium) VMware vCenter Server partial file read

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-22T14:53:33.000Z ##

VMware security advisory: VMSA-2024-0011:VMware ESXi, Workstation, Fusion and vCenter Server updates address multiple security vulnerabilities
VMware ESXi, Workstation, Fusion and vCenter Server updates address multiple security vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-22273, CVE-2024-22274, CVE-2024-22275) No mention of exploitation. h/t: @jgreig

  • CVE-2024-22273 (8.1 high) out-of-bounds read/write
  • CVE-2024-22274 (7.2 high) VMware vCenter Server authenticated remote-code execution
  • CVE-2024-22275 (4.9 medium) VMware vCenter Server partial file read

#VMware #vulnerability #CVE #ESXi #vCenter #CVE_2024_22273 #CVE_2024_22274 #CVE_2024_22275

CVE-2024-27130
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-21T18:31:32

10 posts

A buffer copy without checking size of input vulnerability has been reported to affect several QNAP operating system versions. If exploited, the vulnerability could allow users to execute code via a network. We have already fixed the vulnerability in the following version: QTS 5.1.7.2770 build 20240520 and later QuTS hero h5.1.7.2770 build 20240520 and later

screaminggoat at 2024-05-21T12:58:54.877Z ##

QNAP security advisory: Vulnerabilities in QTS and QuTS hero
Following the public disclosure by watchTowr (see parent toot above), QNAP patches five of the vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-21902: Missing authentication could allow authenticated users to read or modify the resource
  • CVE-2024-27127: double free vulnerability allows for RCE
  • CVE-2024-27128, CVE-2024-27129, CVE-2024-27130: buffer overflow to RCE

No CVSS scores at this time, no mention of exploitation. h/t @campuscodi

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-05-21T12:29:56.000Z ##

Last week, watchTowr Labs published a report about 15 vulnerabilities in QNAP NAS devices: https://labs.watchtowr.com/qnap-qts-qnapping-at-the-wheel-cve-2024-27130-and-friends/

QNAP patched only four.

Days after a PoC was published online, QNAP patched another five

https://www.qnap.com/en/security-advisory/qsa-24-23

##
AAKL at 2024-05-20T16:14:45.654Z ##

This includes CVE-2024-27130 and a very long list of other CVs. #Infosec #cybersecurity

If you missed this, #QNAP QTS zero-day in Share feature gets public RCE exploit https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/qnap-qts-zero-day-in-share-feature-gets-public-rce-exploit/

The related WtchTower report is from May 17: https://labs.watchtowr.com/qnap-qts-qnapping-at-the-wheel-cve-2024-27130-and-friends/

More:

Researchers call out QNAP for dragging its heels on patch development https://www.theregister.com/2024/05/20/qnap_watchtowr/ @theregister

##
gnyman at 2024-05-20T07:25:47.589Z ##

PSA

If you have a #qnap NAS (like I do). please do not expose it on the internet. Only bad things will come from that. (And even (qnap themselves)[https://www.qnap.com/en/how-to/faq/article/what-is-the-best-practice-for-enhancing-nas-security] say so)

Use https://tailscale.com/qnap or similar if you need to access it from the outside. If you need to easily share files and don't want to use a cloud service? I don't know..

QNAP unpatched vulnerabilities: Security firm watchTowr Labs has found ~15 vulnerabilities~ in the firmware of QNAP network attached storage devices. Some of the vulnerabilities can be used for remote code execution attacks that do not require authentication. watchTowr reported the bugs in December of last year, but the vendor has only ~patched four~ of the fifteen so far. The security firm has published a ~PoC~ for one of the worst of the 15 bugs.
[risky-biz-newsletter])(https://news.risky.biz/risky-biz-news-germany-sues-microsoft-for-details-on-past-hack/?ref=risky-business-news-newsletter)

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-17T14:05:55.976Z ##

watchTowr: QNAP QTS - QNAPping At The Wheel (CVE-2024-27130 and friends)
Always a pleasure to read vulnerability analyses from watchTowr as they take us through QNAP's Network Attached Storage (NAS) products QTS (operating system), QuTSCloud (VM-optimized version) and QTS hero (high performance features version). NAS are very attractive targets for ransomware actors, and watchTowr walks us through finding vulnerabilities and providing a working exploit (proofs of concept available). A lot of humor injected throughout.
watchTowr is extremely transparent in listing all of the vulnerabilities found (and what's under embargo), with a timeline, communications and coordination with QNAP (JetBrains take note!), and their vulnerability disclosure policy.

cc: @wdormann you might find this interesting if you haven't read it already

#QNAP #CVE #QNAP #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-21T12:58:54.000Z ##

Following the public disclosure by watchTowr (see parent toot above), QNAP patches five of the vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-21902: Missing authentication could allow authenticated users to read or modify the resource
  • CVE-2024-27127: double free vulnerability allows for RCE
  • CVE-2024-27128, CVE-2024-27129, CVE-2024-27130: buffer overflow to RCE

No CVSS scores at this time, no mention of exploitation. h/t @campuscodi

#vulnerability #watchtowr #QNAP #CVE_2024_21902 #CVE_2024_27127 #CVE_2024_27128 #CVE_2024_27129 #CVE_2024_27130

##

CVE-2024-33899(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-21T18:31:14

2 posts

RARLAB WinRAR before 7.00, on Linux and UNIX platforms, allows attackers to spoof the screen output, or cause a denial of service, via ANSI escape sequences.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-22T14:59:27.092Z ##

Siddharth Dushantha: ANSI Escape Injection Vulnerability in WinRAR
Siddharth provides vulnerability details for an ANSI escape sequence injection vulnerability in the console versions of RAR and UnRAR, affecting versions 6.24 and earlier. This vulnerability was patched in version 7.00 on 28 February 2024. Siddharth provides proof of concept for the vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024–33899 for Linux/Unix and CVE-2024–36052 for Windows. h/t: @buherator

#CVE_2024_33899 #CVE_2024_36052 #RAR #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-22T14:59:27.000Z ##

CVE-2024-4985
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-21T12:37:59.687000

18 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability was present in the GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) when utilizing SAML single sign-on authentication with the optional encrypted assertions feature. This vulnerability allowed an attacker to forge a SAML response to provision and/or gain access to a user with site administrator privileges. Exploitation of this vulnerability would allow unauthorized access to

jbzfn@mastodon.social at 2024-05-25T12:20:00.000Z ##

🥸 Critical GitHub Enterprise Server Flaw Allows Authentication Bypass

"On instances that use SAML single sign-on (SSO) authentication with the optional encrypted assertions feature, an attacker could forge a SAML response to provision and/or gain access to a user with administrator privileges"

https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/critical-github-enterprise-server-flaw.html

#GitHub #SAML #Infosec #CVE #CVE20244985

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-05-22T08:17:27.072Z ##

Critical GitHub Enterprise Server Flaw Allows Authentication Bypass

Date: May 21, 2024

CVE: [[CVE-2024-4985]]

Vulnerability Type: Improper Authentication

CWE: [[CWE-287]]

Sources: Cyber Security News, SecurityWeek, The Hacker News

Issue Summary

A critical vulnerability in GitHub Enterprise Server, identified as CVE-2024-4985, was discovered that allows attackers to bypass authentication. This flaw, found in versions 3.9.14, 3.10.11, 3.11.9, and 3.12.3, permits unauthorized access to repositories and sensitive data by exploiting a weakness in the SAML SSO authentication process.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerability arises from a logic error in the SAML SSO authentication process, where the server fails to verify the validity of digital signatures on SAML responses properly. Attackers can craft SAML assertions with any certificate, which the server incorrectly accepts, allowing the spoofing of user identities, including admin accounts.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitHub Enterprise Server versions 3.9.14
  • GitHub Enterprise Server versions 3.10.11
  • GitHub Enterprise Server versions 3.11.9
  • GitHub Enterprise Server versions 3.12.3

Impact Assessment

Exploitation of this vulnerability could lead to unauthorized access to private repositories, sensitive data, and administrative controls. This can result in data breaches, code tampering, and potential intellectual property theft.

Patches or Workaround

GitHub has released patched versions (3.9.15, 3.10.12, 3.11.10, and 3.12.4) to address this issue. As an interim measure, enabling SAML certificate pinning can mitigate the risk. Additionally, auditing access logs for suspicious activity and rotating credentials is advised.

Tags

#GitHub #CVE20244985 #SAML #AuthenticationBypass #SecurityFlaw #EnterpriseSecurity #DataBreach #PatchUpdate #CyberSecurity

##
jbzfn@mastodon.social at 2024-05-25T12:20:00.000Z ##

🥸 Critical GitHub Enterprise Server Flaw Allows Authentication Bypass

"On instances that use SAML single sign-on (SSO) authentication with the optional encrypted assertions feature, an attacker could forge a SAML response to provision and/or gain access to a user with administrator privileges"

https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/critical-github-enterprise-server-flaw.html

#GitHub #SAML #Infosec #CVE #CVE20244985

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-22T08:17:27.000Z ##

Critical GitHub Enterprise Server Flaw Allows Authentication Bypass

Date: May 21, 2024

CVE: [[CVE-2024-4985]]

Vulnerability Type: Improper Authentication

CWE: [[CWE-287]]

Sources: Cyber Security News, SecurityWeek, The Hacker News

Issue Summary

A critical vulnerability in GitHub Enterprise Server, identified as CVE-2024-4985, was discovered that allows attackers to bypass authentication. This flaw, found in versions 3.9.14, 3.10.11, 3.11.9, and 3.12.3, permits unauthorized access to repositories and sensitive data by exploiting a weakness in the SAML SSO authentication process.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerability arises from a logic error in the SAML SSO authentication process, where the server fails to verify the validity of digital signatures on SAML responses properly. Attackers can craft SAML assertions with any certificate, which the server incorrectly accepts, allowing the spoofing of user identities, including admin accounts.

Vulnerable Products

  • GitHub Enterprise Server versions 3.9.14
  • GitHub Enterprise Server versions 3.10.11
  • GitHub Enterprise Server versions 3.11.9
  • GitHub Enterprise Server versions 3.12.3

Impact Assessment

Exploitation of this vulnerability could lead to unauthorized access to private repositories, sensitive data, and administrative controls. This can result in data breaches, code tampering, and potential intellectual property theft.

Patches or Workaround

GitHub has released patched versions (3.9.15, 3.10.12, 3.11.10, and 3.12.4) to address this issue. As an interim measure, enabling SAML certificate pinning can mitigate the risk. Additionally, auditing access logs for suspicious activity and rotating credentials is advised.

Tags

#GitHub #CVE20244985 #SAML #AuthenticationBypass #SecurityFlaw #EnterpriseSecurity #DataBreach #PatchUpdate #CyberSecurity

screaminggoat at 2024-05-23T16:35:55.617Z ##

Proof of concept for CVE-2024-4985 (10.0 critical) is now available: https://github.com/absholi7ly/Bypass-authentication-GitHub-Enterprise-Server

See parent toot above for security advisory. h/t: @dhananjay

#CVE_2024_4985 #vulnerability #GitHub #CVE #proofofconcept #POC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-21T15:12:44.679Z ##

GitHub security advisory: Enterprise Server 3.9.15
CVE-2024-4985 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) On instances that use SAML single sign-on (SSO) authentication with the optional encrypted assertions feature, an attacker could forge a SAML response to provision and/or gain access to a user with administrator privileges.

No mention of exploitation. See related Bleeping Computer reporting: GitHub warns of SAML auth bypass flaw in Enterprise Server

#CVE_2024_4985 #vulnerability #GitHub #CVE #SAML

CVE-2024-4761

EPSS: 0.58%

updated 2024-05-20T15:31:41

18 posts

Out of bounds write in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.207 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-20T19:17:23.683Z ##

Zero Day Engineering: Google Chrome "actively exploited" bug chain on Viz & v8-wasm (May 2024)
Alisa Esage provides root cause analyses for both CVE-2024-4671 (Use after free in Visuals, disclosed 09 May 2024, added to CISA KEV on 13 May) and CVE-2024-4761 (Out of bounds write in V8 allowing for RCE, disclosed 13 May 2024, added to KEV on 16 May). These were both exploited zero-days at the time of their disclosure.

h/t: @gnyman

CVE-2024-4947: Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.60 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

CVE-2024-4761: Out of bounds write in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.207 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

##
gnyman at 2024-05-20T06:57:14.944Z ##

Chrome zero-day analysis: Security researcher Alisa Esage has published root cause analysis for two of the three Chrome zero-days that Google patched last week—CVE-2024-4761 and CVE-2024-4671 (yes, very confusing CVEs).
risky-biz

Every time I see a #Chrome RCE I loose a bit more hope.

In my book, Chrome was the new browser which was built "secure by design". Giving up on all the legacy crap which made it possible to get compromised by just visiting a website.

But here we are, where Alisa Esage states

Based on my evaluation, the exploit can be recreated in about a week by someone with good knowledge and experience in Chrome exploitation, so it's definitely worth updating Chrome-based infrastructures as soon as possible.

Both bugs seem to be possible because Chrome is c++ though? So maybe #rustlang is the saviour who will finally free us from this.

##
nathans at 2024-05-16T18:06:02.842Z ##

One more reason to not use Chrome!

Google fixes third actively exploited Chrome zero-day in a week

Google has released a new emergency Chrome security update to address the third zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks within a week.

"Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild," the search giant said in a security advisory published on Wednesday.

The high-severity zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2024-4947) is caused by a type confusion weakness in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine reported by Kaspersky's Vasily Berdnikov and Boris Larin.

Although such flaws generally enable threat actors to trigger browser crashes by reading or writing memory out of buffer bounds, they can also exploit them for arbitrary code execution on targeted devices.

The other two actively exploited Chrome zero-days patched this week are CVE-2024-4671 (a use-after-free flaw in the Visuals component) and CVE-2024-4761 (an out-of-bounds write bug in the V8 JavaScript engine)

#News #Security #CyberSecurity #Tech #Google #Chrome #ZeroDay

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/google/google-fixes-CVE-2024-4947-third-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-in-a-week/

One more reason to not use Chrome!

Google fixes third actively exploited Chrome zero-day in a week

Google has released a new emergency Chrome security update to address the third zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks within a week.

"Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild," the search giant said in a security advisory published on Wednesday.

The high-severity zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2024-4947) is caused by a type confusion weakness in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine reported by Kaspersky's Vasily Berdnikov and Boris Larin.

Although such flaws generally enable threat actors to trigger browser crashes by reading or writing memory out of buffer bounds, they can also exploit them for arbitrary code execution on targeted devices.

The other two actively exploited Chrome zero-days patched this week are CVE-2024-4671 (a use-after-free flaw in the Visuals component) and CVE-2024-4761 (an out-of-bounds write bug in the V8 JavaScript engine)

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T19:11:39.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC): Chromium: CVE-2024-4761 Out of bounds write in V8
MSRC adds the Chromium security advisory 2 hours later as an afterthought. This actively exploited Google Chrome zero-day CVE-2024-4761 is in "Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable."

avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T18:30:01.000Z ##

#Google Chrome emergency #update fixes 6th zero-day exploited in 2024

Google has released another #security update tracked as CVE-2024-4761 - out of bounds memory write in the JavaScript V8 engine. Under active exploitation in the wild.

This is a different vulnerability than the use after free they just fixed a few days ago.

This affects all #Chromium based browsers (ex: Edge, Brave, Vivaldi). Forks should be rolling out updates ASAP.

Update ASAP.

@screaminggoat

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-14T13:23:23.000Z ##

I feel the need to point out that with this update, Opera went to Chromium "124.0.6367.62"… yes you read that right ".62" which is a build long before both recent 0-day exploits (it is from last month).

To be clear, Opera is not faster at responding to the CVE-2024-4761 0-day than Edge or Brave (or Chrome and Vivaldi obviously), it is much, much slower. Unless they have backported security fixes and their Changelog gives no indication of that https://blogs.opera.com/desktop/changelog-for-110/ , they are missing all of the following security improvements

• High CVE-2024-4761: Out of bounds write in V8 [0-day exploit in the wild]
• High CVE-2024-4671: Use after free in Visuals [0-day exploit in the wild]
• High CVE-2024-4558: Use after free in ANGLE
• High CVE-2024-4559: Heap buffer overflow in WebAudio
• High CVE-2024-4331: Use after free in Picture In Picture
• High CVE-2024-4368: Use after free in Dawn
• Critical CVE-2024-4058: Type Confusion in ANGLE
• High CVE-2024-4059: Out of bounds read in V8 API
• High CVE-2024-4060: Use after free in Dawn

#CVE_2024_4761 #CVE_2024_4671 #Chrome #OperaBrowser #OperaWebBrowser #ZeroDay

##

CVE-2024-4323
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-20T12:30:36

27 posts

A memory corruption vulnerability in Fluent Bit versions 2.0.7 thru 3.0.3. This issue lies in the embedded http server’s parsing of trace requests and may result in denial of service conditions, information disclosure, or remote code execution.

3 repos

https://github.com/d0rb/CVE-2024-4323

https://github.com/skilfoy/CVE-2024-4323-Exploit-POC

https://github.com/yuansec/CVE-2024-4323-dos_poc

screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T14:47:21.901Z ##

Aqua Security: Linguistic Lumberjack: Understanding CVE-2024-4323 in Fluent Bit
Aqua provides an overview of the Linguistic Lumberjack vulnerability CVE-2024-4323 (see parent toot above for security advisory and CVE details). Fluent Bit is a highly popular open-source data collector and processor designed for handling large volumes of log data from various sources, and is supposedly used by all major cloud providers.
The flaw is due to improper validation of input names in requests, which can be exploited to cause memory corruption. This can result in denial-of-service attacks or information exposure, with remote code execution being possible under certain conditions.
Aqua's investigation reports that the built-in http server needs to be exposed to the internet in order for Fluent Bit to be vulnerable, and that 20 versions from various popular open source tools on Docker Hub had http turned off by default.
Aqua recommends upgrading Fluent Bit to the fixed version 3.0.4.

#LinguisticLumberjack #CVE_2024_4324 #CVE #vulnerability #FluentBit

ariadne@treehouse.systems at 2024-05-21T19:32:47.000Z ##

well, i see fluent-bit folks are adding defensive programming stuff to "fix" CVE-2024-4323, sigh

the correct fix for that CVE is to adjust flb_sds_create_len() and related functions to take size_t for object sizes

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-05-21T10:18:35.000Z ##

Tenable security researchers have found a vulnerability in the Fluent Bit monitoring and logging utility.

Named Linguistic Lumberjack (CVE-2024-4323), the vulnerability can be used for denial of service, information disclosure, or remote code execution.

A fix was committed to the Fluent Bit code last week, but the project has not released an official fix/

Tenable fears threat actors may exploit knowledge of the bug to launch attacks.

https://www.tenable.com/blog/linguistic-lumberjack-attacking-cloud-services-via-logging-endpoints-fluent-bit-cve-2024-432

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-21T09:55:04.000Z ##

'Linguistic Lumberjack' Flaw in Logging Utility Fluent Bit Impacts Cloud Services https://www.tenable.com/blog/linguistic-lumberjack-attacking-cloud-services-via-logging-endpoints-fluent-bit-cve-2024-4323?&web_view=true #MalwareandVulnerabilities

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-20T19:28:28.373Z ##

Tenable: Linguistic Lumberjack: Attacking Cloud Services via Logging Endpoints (Fluent Bit - CVE-2024-4323)
Tenable provides vulnerability details and proof of concept for CVE-2024-4323 (9.8 critical, disclosed 20 May 2024 by Tenable). Fluent Bit is a logging utility heavily used by all major cloud providers. This memory corruption vulnerability (dubbed Linguistic Lumberjack cc: @shellsharks) could result in denial of service conditions, information disclosure, or remote code execution.

h/t: @jgreig

#CVE_2024_4323 #LinguisticLumberjack #Fluent #vulnerability #CVE

##
AAKL at 2024-05-20T17:53:43.563Z ##

Tenable: Linguistic Lumberjack: Attacking Cloud Services via Logging Endpoints (Fluent Bit - CVE-2024-4323) https://www.tenable.com/blog/linguistic-lumberjack-attacking-cloud-services-via-logging-endpoints-fluent-bit-cve-2024-4323 @tenablesecurity #cybersecurity #infosec

via @SecurityWeek https://www.securityweek.com/vulnerability-found-in-fluent-bit-utility-used-by-major-cloud-tech-companies/ @ekovacs

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-25T14:47:21.000Z ##

Aqua Security: Linguistic Lumberjack: Understanding CVE-2024-4323 in Fluent Bit
Aqua provides an overview of the Linguistic Lumberjack vulnerability CVE-2024-4323 (see parent toot above for security advisory and CVE details). Fluent Bit is a highly popular open-source data collector and processor designed for handling large volumes of log data from various sources, and is supposedly used by all major cloud providers.
The flaw is due to improper validation of input names in requests, which can be exploited to cause memory corruption. This can result in denial-of-service attacks or information exposure, with remote code execution being possible under certain conditions.
Aqua's investigation reports that the built-in http server needs to be exposed to the internet in order for Fluent Bit to be vulnerable, and that 20 versions from various popular open source tools on Docker Hub had http turned off by default.
Aqua recommends upgrading Fluent Bit to the fixed version 3.0.4.

#LinguisticLumberjack #CVE_2024_4324 #CVE #vulnerability #FluentBit

ariadne@treehouse.systems at 2024-05-21T19:32:47.000Z ##

well, i see fluent-bit folks are adding defensive programming stuff to "fix" CVE-2024-4323, sigh

the correct fix for that CVE is to adjust flb_sds_create_len() and related functions to take size_t for object sizes

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-05-21T10:18:35.000Z ##

Tenable security researchers have found a vulnerability in the Fluent Bit monitoring and logging utility.

Named Linguistic Lumberjack (CVE-2024-4323), the vulnerability can be used for denial of service, information disclosure, or remote code execution.

A fix was committed to the Fluent Bit code last week, but the project has not released an official fix/

Tenable fears threat actors may exploit knowledge of the bug to launch attacks.

https://www.tenable.com/blog/linguistic-lumberjack-attacking-cloud-services-via-logging-endpoints-fluent-bit-cve-2024-432

##

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T19:28:28.000Z ##

Tenable: Linguistic Lumberjack: Attacking Cloud Services via Logging Endpoints (Fluent Bit - CVE-2024-4323)
Tenable provides vulnerability details and proof of concept for CVE-2024-4323 (9.8 critical, disclosed 20 May 2024 by Tenable). Fluent Bit is a logging utility heavily used by all major cloud providers. This memory corruption vulnerability (dubbed Linguistic Lumberjack cc: @shellsharks) could result in denial of service conditions, information disclosure, or remote code execution.

h/t: @jgreig

#CVE_2024_4323 #LinguisticLumberjack #Fluent #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-3661
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-05-18T05:03:51

3 posts

By design, the DHCP protocol does not authenticate messages, including for example the classless static route option (121). An attacker with the ability to send DHCP messages can manipulate routes to redirect VPN traffic, allowing the attacker to read, disrupt, or possibly modify network traffic that was expected to be protected by the VPN. Many, if not most VPN systems based on IP routing are sus

screaminggoat at 2024-05-16T16:13:04.563Z ##

Palo Alto Networks security advisory: CVE-2024-3661 Impact of TunnelVision Vulnerability
Palo Alto Networks evaluated the TunnelVision vulnerability and determined that GlobalProtect app on Linux is affected (Palo Alto Networks plans to release a patch in an upcoming major release). For All versions of GlobalProtect app on Windows and macOS without Endpoint Traffic Policy Enforcement set to All Traffic are affected (Endpoint Traffic Policy Enforcement is disabled by default). All versions of GlobalProtect app on iOS without IncludeAllNetworks set to 1 are affected.

Interestingly, Palo Alto Networks uses CVSSv4.0 for CVE-2024-3661 and rates it 2.1 low severity.

#PaloAltoNetworks #CVE_2024_3661 #TunnelVision

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-16T16:13:04.000Z ##

Palo Alto Networks security advisory: CVE-2024-3661 Impact of TunnelVision Vulnerability
Palo Alto Networks evaluated the TunnelVision vulnerability and determined that GlobalProtect app on Linux is affected (Palo Alto Networks plans to release a patch in an upcoming major release). For All versions of GlobalProtect app on Windows and macOS without Endpoint Traffic Policy Enforcement set to All Traffic are affected (Endpoint Traffic Policy Enforcement is disabled by default). All versions of GlobalProtect app on iOS without IncludeAllNetworks set to 1 are affected.

Interestingly, Palo Alto Networks uses CVSSv4.0 for CVE-2024-3661 and rates it 2.1 low severity.

CVE-2023-52424(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-17T21:32:12

3 posts

The IEEE 802.11 standard sometimes enables an adversary to trick a victim into connecting to an unintended or untrusted network with Home WEP, Home WPA3 SAE-loop. Enterprise 802.1X/EAP, Mesh AMPE, or FILS, aka an "SSID Confusion" issue. This occurs because the SSID is not always used to derive the pairwise master key or session keys, and because there is not a protected exchange of an SSID during

jbhall56 at 2024-05-17T13:25:24.564Z ##

The SSID Confusion attack, tracked as CVE-2023-52424, impacts all operating systems and Wi-Fi clients, including home and mesh networks that are based on WEP, WPA3, 802.11X/EAP, and AMPE protocols. https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/new-wi-fi-vulnerability-enabling.html

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-17T13:25:24.000Z ##

The SSID Confusion attack, tracked as CVE-2023-52424, impacts all operating systems and Wi-Fi clients, including home and mesh networks that are based on WEP, WPA3, 802.11X/EAP, and AMPE protocols. https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/new-wi-fi-vulnerability-enabling.html

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T15:16:12.000Z ##

Top10VPN: New WiFi Vulnerability: The SSID Confusion Attack
Currently trending (#3) on Twitter: Top10VPN discloses a new vulnerability arising from a design flaw in the IEEE 802.11 WiFi standard. This vulnerability CVE-2023-52424 (no CVSSv3 score available) impacts all operating systems and WiFi clients. Attackers can trick WiFi clients on any operating system into connecting to a untrusted network. Any VPN with the functionality to auto-disable when connected to trusted networks will be fooled into turning itself off.

#vulnerability #wifi #ssidconfusion #CVE_2023_52424

##

CVE-2024-30060
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-17T18:36:05.263000

2 posts

Azure Monitor Agent Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-05-16T23:03:16.608Z ##

Microsoft out-of-band zero-day: CVE-2024-30060 - Security Update Guide
CVE-2024-30060 (7.8 high, disclosed 16 May 2024 by Microsoft) Azure Monitor Agent Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability with CWE-59: Improper Link Resolution Before File Access ('Link Following')
Is marked publicly disclosed, but Not Exploited, Exploitation LESS likely.

What privileges could be gained by an attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability?
An authenticated attacker would be able to delete targeted files on a system which could result in them gaining SYSTEM privileges.

What actions do customers need to take to protect themselves from this vulnerability?
We released CVE-2024-30060 to help keep customers protected. Customers who have installed the latest updates, or have automatic updates enabled, are already protected. Customers who have disabled Automatic Extension Upgrades or would like to upgrade an extension immediately must manually update their Azure Monitor Agent to the latest version. For more information on how to perform a manual update, see Manage Azure Monitor Agent.

cc: @serghei @campuscodi @mttaggart @GossiTheDog

#CVE_2024_30060 #zeroday #vulnerability #Microsoft

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-16T23:03:16.000Z ##

Microsoft out-of-band zero-day: CVE-2024-30060 - Security Update Guide
CVE-2024-30060 (7.8 high, disclosed 16 May 2024 by Microsoft) Azure Monitor Agent Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability with CWE-59: Improper Link Resolution Before File Access ('Link Following')
Is marked publicly disclosed, but Not Exploited, Exploitation LESS likely.

What privileges could be gained by an attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability?
An authenticated attacker would be able to delete targeted files on a system which could result in them gaining SYSTEM privileges.

What actions do customers need to take to protect themselves from this vulnerability?
We released CVE-2024-30060 to help keep customers protected. Customers who have installed the latest updates, or have automatic updates enabled, are already protected. Customers who have disabled Automatic Extension Upgrades or would like to upgrade an extension immediately must manually update their Azure Monitor Agent to the latest version. For more information on how to perform a manual update, see Manage Azure Monitor Agent.

CVE-2024-22476
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-16T21:32:09

4 posts

Improper input validation in some Intel(R) Neural Compressor software before version 2.5.0 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via remote access.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-17T15:44:47.191Z ##

Intel security advisory: Intel® Neural Compressor Software Advisory
Intel scores a perfect 10.0 CVSSv3 score (critical severity) 🥳 with CVE-2024-22476 : Improper input validation in some Intel Neural Compressor software before version 2.5.0 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via remote access.
Also included is CVE-2024-21792 (4.7 medium) Time-of-check Time-of-use race condition in Intel Neural Compressor software before version 2.5.0 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.

No mention of exploitation. cc: @cR0w h/t: @Newk

#Intel #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_22476 #CVE_2024_21792

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
CISA adds only the Microsoft exploited zero days CVE-2024-30051 and CVE-2024-30040 to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.

#CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #eitw #zeroday #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_30040 #CVE_2024_30051

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T21:03:30.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots The five alarm fire is definitely CVE-2024-30051 for sure. Kaspersky states that they discovered an exploitation guide regarding a Windows Desktop Window Manager (DWM) vulnerability uploaded to VirusTotal. And while the described exploitation process is identical to CVE-2023-36033, the vulnerability was different (new): https://securelist.com/cve-2024-30051/112618/

We have seen it used together with QakBot and other malware, and believe that multiple threat actors have access to it.

In your blog post, I think it ought to be mentioned that CVE-2024-30046 is only considered a zero-day because it's marked Publicly Disclosed. https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-30046

#CVE_2024_30051 #CVE_2024_30046 #PatchTuesday #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T20:12:05.000Z ##

#Microsoft May 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 3 zero-days, 61 flaws

Three zero-days:

CVE-2024-30040 - Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass

CVE-2024-30051 - Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege

CVE-2024-30046 - denial of service (DoS) flaw in Visual Studio

These are (the first 2, not the DoS) actively exploited. There are also numerous other #security fixes for various Microsoft products that aren't necessarily actively exploited, but you should update ASAP!

#cve #cybersecurity #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/microsoft-may-2024-patch-tuesday-fixes-3-zero-days-61-flaws/

##
zeljkazorz@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T18:55:32.000Z ##

Microsoft has released fixes for 59 CVE-numbered vulnerabilities, including two zero-days (CVE-2024-30051, CVE-2024-30040) actively exploited by attackers.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T17:23:03.000Z ##

Kaspersky writes a related blog post about one of the zero-days: QakBot attacks with Windows zero-day (CVE-2024-30051)
The blog post details how a document uploaded to VirusTotal on 01 April 2024 described an exploitation process for Windows Desktop Window Manager (DWM) identical to CVE-2023-36033 but with a different vulnerability. Kaspersky identified that an exploit was used together with QakBot and other malware, and believe that multiple threat actors have access to it.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @mttaggart @deepthoughts10

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T17:04:14.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft. 61 vulnerabilities, 3 zero days:

  • CVE-2024-30051 (7.8 high) Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability publicly disclosed and exploited
  • CVE-2024-30040 (8.8 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability exploited
  • CVE-2024-30046 (5.9 medium) Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability publicly disclosed

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @mttaggart @deepthoughts10

#eitw #activeexploitation #Microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #MSRC #CVE_2024_30040 #CVE_2024_30046 #CVE_2024_30051

(7.5 HIGH)

updated 2024-05-16T18:30:42

2 posts

##

CVE-2024-30040
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.94%

updated 2024-05-16T18:01:55.157000

4 posts

Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T21:05:26.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
CISA adds only the Microsoft exploited zero days CVE-2024-30051 and CVE-2024-30040 to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.

#CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #eitw #zeroday #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_30040 #CVE_2024_30051

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T20:12:05.000Z ##

#Microsoft May 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 3 zero-days, 61 flaws

Three zero-days:

CVE-2024-30040 - Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass

CVE-2024-30051 - Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege

CVE-2024-30046 - denial of service (DoS) flaw in Visual Studio

These are (the first 2, not the DoS) actively exploited. There are also numerous other #security fixes for various Microsoft products that aren't necessarily actively exploited, but you should update ASAP!

#cve #cybersecurity #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/microsoft-may-2024-patch-tuesday-fixes-3-zero-days-61-flaws/

##
zeljkazorz@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T18:55:32.000Z ##

Microsoft has released fixes for 59 CVE-numbered vulnerabilities, including two zero-days (CVE-2024-30051, CVE-2024-30040) actively exploited by attackers.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/14/patch-tuesday-cve-2024-30051-cve-2024-30040/

#Patch #cybersecurity #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T17:04:14.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft. 61 vulnerabilities, 3 zero days:

  • CVE-2024-30051 (7.8 high) Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability publicly disclosed and exploited
  • CVE-2024-30040 (8.8 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability exploited
  • CVE-2024-30046 (5.9 medium) Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability publicly disclosed

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @mttaggart @deepthoughts10
