##

CVE-2024-20389
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-16T15:31:45

1 posts

A vulnerability in the ConfD CLI and the Cisco Crosswork Network Services Orchestrator CLI could allow an authenticated, low-privileged, local attacker to read and write arbitrary files as root on the underlying operating system. This vulnerability is due to improper authorization enforcement when specific CLI commands are used. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by executing an affec

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T16:10:56.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (Wednesday) from Cisco:

  • CVE-2024-20394 (5.5 medium) Cisco AppDynamics Network Visibility Service Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20391 (6.8 medium) Cisco Secure Client for Windows with Network Access Manager Module Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20369 (4.7 medium) Cisco Crosswork Network Services Orchestrator Open Redirect Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20366 (7.8 high)Cisco Crosswork Network Services Orchestrator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20256, CVE-2024-20257, CVE-2024-20258 (6.1 medium) Cisco Secure Email and Web Manager, Secure Email Gateway, and Secure Web Appliance Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20392 (6.1 medium) Cisco Secure Email Gateway HTTP Response Splitting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20326, CVE-2024-20389 (7.8 high) ConfD CLI Privilege Escalation and Arbitrary File Read and Write Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20326, CVE-2024-20389 (7.8 high) Cisco Crosswork Network Services Orchestrator Vulnerabilities

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in [these] advisor[ies].

#Cisco #vulnerability #CVE

  • CVE-2024-20394 (5.5 medium) Cisco AppDynamics Network Visibility Service Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20391 (6.8 medium) Cisco Secure Client for Windows with Network Access Manager Module Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

  • CVE-2024-20366 (7.8 high)Cisco Crosswork Network Services Orchestrator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

CVE-2024-35301
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-16T13:03:05.353000

2 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.1 commit status publisher didn't check project scope of the GitHub App token

screaminggoat at 2024-05-16T18:12:49.317Z ##

Ya boy @screaminggoat staying on top of JetBrains--and their lack of security advisories. On 03 May 2024, JetBrains announced a new TeamCity version (see parent toot above). Today, those unidentified security fixes were assigned CVEs:

  • CVE-2024-35300 (CVSSv3: 3.5 low) In JetBrains TeamCity between 2024.03 and 2024.03.1 several stored XSS in the available updates page were possible
  • CVE-2024-35301 (5.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.1 commit status publisher didn't check project scope of the GitHub App token
  • CVE-2024-35302 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.11 stored XSS during restore from backup was possible

cc: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_35300 #CVE_2024_35301 #CVE_2024_35302 #CVE #TeamCity

##

CVE-2024-4950(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-15T21:31:35

4 posts

Inappropriate implementation in Downloads in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.60 allowed a remote attacker who convinced a user to engage in specific UI gestures to perform UI spoofing via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Low)

screaminggoat at 2024-05-17T12:46:59.103Z ##

@browserversiontracker @ruario
For context, Microsoft Edge was updated against the 4 Chromium vulnerabilities patched Wednesday night:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4947 Type Confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild.
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4948 Use after free in Dawn
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4949 Use after free in V8
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4950 Inappropriate implementation in Downloads

Release notes for Microsoft Edge Security Updates:

Microsoft has a fix for CVE-2024-4947 to Microsoft Edge Stable Channel (Version 124.0.2478.109) and Extended Stable channel (Version 124.0.2478.109), which has been reported by the Chromium team as having an exploit in the wild.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-17T02:29:42.089Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) put out several Chromium security advisories:

  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4947 Type Confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild.
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4948 Use after free in Dawn
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4949 Use after free in V8
  • Chromium: CVE-2024-4950 Inappropriate implementation in Downloads

The vulnerabilities are in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable.

Moreover, according to the Release notes for Microsoft Edge Security Updates:

Microsoft has a fix for CVE-2024-4947 to Microsoft Edge Stable Channel (Version 124.0.2478.109) and Extended Stable channel (Version 124.0.2478.109), which has been reported by the Chromium team as having an exploit in the wild.

See parent toot above for original source. cc: @ruario

(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-15T18:30:42

1 posts

A vulnerability in Cisco AppDynamics Network Visibility Agent could allow an unauthenticated, local attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to the inability to handle unexpected input. An attacker who has local device access could exploit this vulnerability by sending an HTTP request to the targeted service. CVE-2024-20391
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-15T18:30:42

1 posts

A vulnerability in the Network Access Manager (NAM) module of Cisco Secure Client could allow an unauthenticated attacker with physical access to an affected device to elevate privileges to SYSTEM. This vulnerability is due to a lack of authentication on a specific function. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code with SYSTEM privileges on an affected device.

CVE-2024-31469
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-15T16:40:19.330000

1 posts

There are buffer overflow vulnerabilities in the underlying Central Communications service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's Access Point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlyin

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T14:46:55.000Z ##

HPE Aruba Networking security advisory: Aruba Access Points Multiple Vulnerabilities
HPE Aruba Networking has released patches for Aruba Access Points running InstantOS and ArubaOS 10 that address 18 security vulnerabilities. CVE-2024-31466, CVE-2024-31467, CVE-2024-31468, CVE-2024-31469, CVE-2024-31470, CVE-2024-31471, CVE-2024-31472, and CVE-2024-31473 are rated critical with a CVSSv3 score of 9.8. 31466-31470 are unauthenticated buffer overflow while 31471-31473 are unauthenticated command injection. The other vulnerabilities include unauth arbitrary file deletion, auth RCE, unauth DoS, and auth sensitive info disclosure. Keep in mind that some products are EoL and not patched.

HPE Aruba Networking is not aware of any public discussion or exploit code targeting these specific vulnerabilities as of the release date of the advisory.

#Aruba #PatchTuesday #vulnerability

Unchecked script execution in Graphic on-click binding in affected LibreOffice versions allows an attacker to create a document which without prompt will execute scripts built-into LibreOffice on clicking a graphic. Such scripts were previously deemed trusted but are now deemed untrusted.

##

CVE-2024-34359
(9.7 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T20:03:00

9 posts

## Description `llama-cpp-python` depends on class `Llama` in `llama.py` to load `.gguf` llama.cpp or Latency Machine Learning Models. The `__init__` constructor built in the `Llama` takes several parameters to configure the loading and running of the model. Other than `NUMA, LoRa settings`, `loading tokenizers,` and `hardware settings`, `__init__` also loads the `chat template` from targeted `.g

shellsharks@shellsharks.social at 2024-05-22T15:38:22.000Z ##

Reporting from SecurityWeek on a new “Critical" vulnerability affecting Jinja2 & llama_cpp_python, dubbed “Llama Drama” https://www.securityweek.com/critical-flaw-in-ai-python-package-can-lead-to-system-and-data-compromise/

Info and PoC video here: https://github.com/abetlen/llama-cpp-python/security/advisories/GHSA-56xg-wfcc-g829

Checkmarx has an official page for the vuln but the author appears to have oopsied the actual blog content putting something else completely different in there… https://checkmarx.com/blog/llama-drama-critical-vulnerability-cve-2024-34359-threatening-your-software-supply-chain/

#cve202434359 #llamadrama #infosec #cybersecurity

FYI: @screaminggoat

A named vuln @jerry can be excited about 🦙😆

##
shellsharks@shellsharks.social at 2024-05-22T15:38:22.000Z ##

Reporting from SecurityWeek on a new “Critical" vulnerability affecting Jinja2 & llama_cpp_python, dubbed “Llama Drama” https://www.securityweek.com/critical-flaw-in-ai-python-package-can-lead-to-system-and-data-compromise/

Info and PoC video here: https://github.com/abetlen/llama-cpp-python/security/advisories/GHSA-56xg-wfcc-g829

Checkmarx has an official page for the vuln but the author appears to have oopsied the actual blog content putting something else completely different in there… https://checkmarx.com/blog/llama-drama-critical-vulnerability-cve-2024-34359-threatening-your-software-supply-chain/

#cve202434359 #llamadrama #infosec #cybersecurity

FYI: @screaminggoat

A named vuln @jerry can be excited about 🦙😆

##

CVE-2024-4367
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T19:17:55.627000

29 posts

A type check was missing when handling fonts in PDF.js, which would allow arbitrary JavaScript execution in the PDF.js context. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126, Firefox ESR < 115.11, and Thunderbird < 115.11.

4 repos

https://github.com/spaceraccoon/detect-cve-2024-4367

https://github.com/s4vvysec/CVE-2024-4367-POC

https://github.com/avalahEE/pdfjs_disable_eval

https://github.com/LOURC0D3/CVE-2024-4367-PoC

DarkWebInformer at 2024-05-22T14:58:12.409Z ##

🚨POC RELEASED🚨PoC for CVE-2024-4367 & CVE-2024-34342: Arbitrary JavaScript execution in PDF.js

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec #CVE20244367 #CVE202434342 #Vulnerability

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1793295146588459283

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-22T14:58:12.000Z ##

🚨POC RELEASED🚨PoC for CVE-2024-4367 & CVE-2024-34342: Arbitrary JavaScript execution in PDF.js

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec #CVE20244367 #CVE202434342 #Vulnerability

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1793295146588459283

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-20T11:55:20.641Z ##

Codean Labs: CVE-2024-4367 – Arbitrary JavaScript execution in PDF.js
Codean Labs provides vulnerability details and proof of concept for CVE-2024-4367 (CVSSv3 score pending). PDF.js is a JavaScript-based PDF viewer maintained by Mozilla. This bug allows an attacker to execute arbitrary JavaScript code as soon as a malicious PDF file is opened. This affects all Firefox users (<126) because PDF.js is used by Firefox to show PDF files, but also seriously impacts many web- and Electron-based applications that (indirectly) use PDF.js for preview functionality.
Note: This vulnerability was included in the security advisories from 15 May 2024, see parent toot above.

#CVE_2024_4367 #Firefox #PDFjs #CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T11:55:20.000Z ##

Codean Labs: CVE-2024-4367 – Arbitrary JavaScript execution in PDF.js
Codean Labs provides vulnerability details and proof of concept for CVE-2024-4367 (CVSSv3 score pending). PDF.js is a JavaScript-based PDF viewer maintained by Mozilla. This bug allows an attacker to execute arbitrary JavaScript code as soon as a malicious PDF file is opened. This affects all Firefox users (<126) because PDF.js is used by Firefox to show PDF files, but also seriously impacts many web- and Electron-based applications that (indirectly) use PDF.js for preview functionality.
Note: This vulnerability was included in the security advisories from 15 May 2024, see parent toot above.

#CVE_2024_4367 #Firefox #PDFjs #CVE #vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-05-20T11:55:20.641Z ##

Codean Labs: CVE-2024-4367 – Arbitrary JavaScript execution in PDF.js
Codean Labs provides vulnerability details and proof of concept for CVE-2024-4367 (CVSSv3 score pending). PDF.js is a JavaScript-based PDF viewer maintained by Mozilla. This bug allows an attacker to execute arbitrary JavaScript code as soon as a malicious PDF file is opened. This affects all Firefox users (<126) because PDF.js is used by Firefox to show PDF files, but also seriously impacts many web- and Electron-based applications that (indirectly) use PDF.js for preview functionality.
Note: This vulnerability was included in the security advisories from 15 May 2024, see parent toot above.

#CVE_2024_4367 #Firefox #PDFjs #CVE #vulnerability

Codean Labs: CVE-2024-4367 – Arbitrary JavaScript execution in PDF.js
Codean Labs provides vulnerability details and proof of concept for CVE-2024-4367 (CVSSv3 score pending). PDF.js is a JavaScript-based PDF viewer maintained by Mozilla. This bug allows an attacker to execute arbitrary JavaScript code as soon as a malicious PDF file is opened. This affects all Firefox users (<126) because PDF.js is used by Firefox to show PDF files, but also seriously impacts many web- and Electron-based applications that (indirectly) use PDF.js for preview functionality.
Note: This vulnerability was included in the security advisories from 15 May 2024, see parent toot above.

PopularLinks@mastodon.social at 2024-05-24T01:20:19.000Z ##

"CVE-2024-4367 - Arbitrary JavaScript execution in PDF.js — Codean Labs"

https://codeanlabs.com/blog/research/cve-2024-4367-arbitrary-js-execution-in-pdf-js/

Seen in 25 statuses.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-23T14:59:01.653Z ##

@campuscodi @wdormann pointed out that the popular note-taking app Obsidian is vulnerable to CVE-2024-4367 (CVSSv3 score pending, disclosed 14 May 2024 by Mozilla, proof of concept available 20 May) This was addressed in Obsidian 1.6.1.

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-05-23T14:55:52.000Z ##

Codean's Thomas Rinsma has published a write-up of a bug he found in Mozilla's PDF.js PDF file viewer.

The bug could have allowed threat actors to run malicious code inside apps where the PDF.js library was used and left misconfigured.

It's a pretty niche scenario, but 10/10 on the nasty scale.

https://codeanlabs.com/blog/research/cve-2024-4367-arbitrary-js-execution-in-pdf-js/

##
pkiff@mastodon.social at 2024-05-21T14:24:54.000Z ##

Not surprised by the new security vulnerability in Mozilla's PDF.js - patched in latest Firefox. But remind me again why browsers try to render PDFs to begin with?

Displaying PDFs in browsers opens a huge new attack surface. PDFs are complex. Browsers render PDF forms poorly and offer only a limited subset of the many accessibility features provided by dedicated PDF software.

I wish none of the browser makers did this.

https://codeanlabs.com/blog/research/cve-2024-4367-arbitrary-js-execution-in-pdf-js/

#PDF #Mozilla #Firefox #Security #Accessibility

##
kubikpixel@chaos.social at 2024-05-21T06:15:10.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-30046
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T19:17:55.627000

4 posts

Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T21:03:30.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots The five alarm fire is definitely CVE-2024-30051 for sure. Kaspersky states that they discovered an exploitation guide regarding a Windows Desktop Window Manager (DWM) vulnerability uploaded to VirusTotal. And while the described exploitation process is identical to CVE-2023-36033, the vulnerability was different (new): https://securelist.com/cve-2024-30051/112618/

We have seen it used together with QakBot and other malware, and believe that multiple threat actors have access to it.

In your blog post, I think it ought to be mentioned that CVE-2024-30046 is only considered a zero-day because it's marked Publicly Disclosed. https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-30046

#CVE_2024_30051 #CVE_2024_30046 #PatchTuesday #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T20:53:27.000Z ##

@avoidthehack It should be noted that only 2 are actively exploited. CVE-2024-30046, the Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability, is only publicly disclosed and marked Not Exploited: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-30046

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T20:12:05.000Z ##

#Microsoft May 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 3 zero-days, 61 flaws

Three zero-days:

CVE-2024-30040 - Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass

CVE-2024-30051 - Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege

CVE-2024-30046 - denial of service (DoS) flaw in Visual Studio

These are (the first 2, not the DoS) actively exploited. There are also numerous other #security fixes for various Microsoft products that aren't necessarily actively exploited, but you should update ASAP!

#cve #cybersecurity #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/microsoft-may-2024-patch-tuesday-fixes-3-zero-days-61-flaws/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T17:04:14.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft. 61 vulnerabilities, 3 zero days:

  • CVE-2024-30051 (7.8 high) Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability publicly disclosed and exploited
  • CVE-2024-30040 (8.8 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability exploited
  • CVE-2024-30046 (5.9 medium) Visual Studio Denial of Service Vulnerability publicly disclosed

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @mttaggart @deepthoughts10

#eitw #activeexploitation #Microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #MSRC #CVE_2024_30040 #CVE_2024_30046 #CVE_2024_30051

##

CVE-2024-26007
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T19:17:55.627000

1 posts

An improper check or handling of exceptional conditions vulnerability [CWE-703] in Fortinet FortiOS version 7.4.1 allows an unauthenticated attacker to provoke a denial of service on the administrative interface via crafted HTTP requests.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T19:07:45.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet: 21 new vulnerabilities (no mention of exploitation) across 18 advisories:

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put
  • FG-IR-23-433 CVE-2023-50180 (5.5 medium) Exposure of password hashes to read-only admin
  • FG-IR-23-137 Format String Bug in cli command
    • CVE-2023-36640 (6.7 medium)
    • CVE-2023-45583 (6.7 medium)
  • FG-IR-23-465 CVE-2024-23664 (6.1 medium) FortiAuthenticator - Open Redirect on /portal/disclaimer
  • FG-IR-24-120 HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Frames Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-27316 for Apache HTTP Server (httpd)
    • CVE-2024-24549 for Apache Tomcat
    • CVE-2024-30255 for Envoy proxy (nghttp2)
    • CVE-2023-45288 for Golang
    • CVE-2024-28182 for nghttp2
    • CVE-2024-27983 for Node.js
    • CVE-2024-3302 for Firefox
  • FG-IR-23-282 CVE-2023-40720 (7.1 high) IDOR over SIP configuration file
  • FG-IR-24-052 CVE-2024-31493 (6.5 medium) Information disclosure in content hub
  • FG-IR-23-222 Multiple improper input validation and authorization vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-23667 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23668 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23669 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23670 (8.8 high)
  • FG-IR-24-017 CVE-2024-26007 (5.3 medium) Node.js crash over administrative interface
  • FG-IR-23-191 CVE-2024-23107 (5.5 medium) Read only administrator can see passwords' hashes
  • FG-IR-24-054 CVE-2024-31491 (8.8 high) Readonly user could execute sensitive operations
  • FG-IR-23-225 CVE-2023-45586 (5.0 medium) SSL-VPN user IP spoofing
  • FG-IR-24-040 CVE-2024-31488 (6.8 medium) Stored and reflected XSS
  • FG-IR-23-474 CVE-2024-23665 (5.9 medium) Unauthorized ADOM operations

#Fortinet #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #FortiOS #HTTP2 #ContinuationFlood

##

CVE-2024-31488
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T19:17:55.627000

1 posts

An improper neutralization of inputs during web page generation vulnerability [CWE-79] in FortiNAC version 9.4.0 through 9.4.4, 9.2.0 through 9.2.8, 9.1.0 through 9.1.10, 8.8.0 through 8.8.11, 8.7.0 through 8.7.6, 7.2.0 through 7.2.3 may allow a remote authenticated attacker to perform stored and reflected cross site scripting (XSS) attack via crafted HTTP requests.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T19:07:45.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet: 21 new vulnerabilities (no mention of exploitation) across 18 advisories:

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put
  • FG-IR-23-433 CVE-2023-50180 (5.5 medium) Exposure of password hashes to read-only admin

  • FG-IR-23-191 CVE-2024-23107 (5.5 medium) Read only administrator can see passwords' hashes
  • FG-IR-24-054 CVE-2024-31491 (8.8 high) Readonly user could execute sensitive operations
  • FG-IR-23-225 CVE-2023-45586 (5.0 medium) SSL-VPN user IP spoofing
  • FG-IR-24-040 CVE-2024-31488 (6.8 medium) Stored and reflected XSS
  • FG-IR-23-474 CVE-2024-23665 (5.9 medium) Unauthorized ADOM operations

CVE-2024-22270
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T18:31:04

2 posts

VMware Workstation and Fusion contain an information disclosure vulnerability in the Host Guest File Sharing (HGFS) functionality. A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine may be able to read privileged information contained in hypervisor memory from a virtual machine.

AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T15:21:58.000Z ##

#VMware Patches Vulnerabilities Exploited at Pwn2Own 2024 #cybersecurity #infosec https://www.securityweek.com/vmware-patches-vulnerabilities-exploited-at-pwn2own-2024/ @SecurityWeek @ekovacs

Affected CVEs: CVE-2024-22267, CVE-2024-22268, CVE-2024-22269, CVE-2024-22270

#Broadcom advisory: https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/support-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/24280

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T14:05:58.000Z ##

VMware security advisory: VMware Workstation and Fusion updates address multiple security vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-22267, CVE-2024-22268, CVE-2024-22269, CVE-2024-22270)

  • CVE-2024-22267 (9.3 critical) VMware Workstation and Fusion vbluetooth use-after-free vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-22268 (7.1 high) VMware Workstation and Fusion Shader heap buffer-overflow vulnerability ()
  • CVE-2024-22269 (7.1 high) VMware Workstation and Fusion vbluetooth information disclosure vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-22270 (7.1 high) VMware Workstation and Fusion HGFS information disclosure vulnerability

#PatchTuesday off to a rough start. No mention of exploitation but it's worth noting that these were demonstrated at Pwn2Own Security Contest 2024. See related Security Week reporting: VMware Patches Vulnerabilities Exploited at Pwn2Own 2024

#vulnerability #Vmware #CVE_2024_22267 #CVE_2024_22268 #CVE_2024_22269 #CVE_2024_22270

##

CVE-2024-23897
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.78%

updated 2024-05-14T17:57:02

2 posts

Jenkins has a built-in command line interface (CLI) to access Jenkins from a script or shell environment. Jenkins uses the args4j library to parse command arguments and options on the Jenkins controller when processing CLI commands. This command parser has a feature that replaces an @ character followed by a file path in an argument with the file’s contents (expandAtFiles). This feature is enable

Nuclei template

33 repos

Jenkins actually came out with a security advisory yesterday 24 May 2024: https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2024-05-24/

updated 2024-05-14T16:13:02.773000

2 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

CVE-2024-27804(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T15:33:12

1 posts

The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, tvOS 17.5, watchOS 10.5, macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

1 repos

https://github.com/R00tkitSMM/CVE-2024-27804

Cyberkid1987@defcon.social at 2024-05-14T19:01:57.000Z ##

❗Attention!

🕷️ Critical Vulnerability Alert: CVE-2024-27804

A high-severity vulnerability has been identified affecting multiple Apple operating systems, including iOS 17.5, iPadOS 17.5, tvOS 17.5, watchOS 10.5, and macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app could potentially execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges due to an issue with memory handling.

🛡️ Risk Information:
- CVSS v2 Base Score: 9.3 (High)
- CVSS v3 Base Score: 7.8 (High)

📅 Published: 2024-05-14

Ensure your systems are updated to the latest versions to mitigate this vulnerability. Stay safe and vigilant!

📄Poc:
https://r00tkitsmm.github.io/fuzzing/2024/05/14/anotherappleavd.html

👤t.me/VasileiadisAnastasis
👥t.me/infosec101
👥t.me/infosec101center

##

CVE-2024-27852(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T15:33:09

1 posts

A privacy issue was addressed with improved client ID handling for alternative app marketplaces. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5. A maliciously crafted webpage may be able to distribute a script that tracks users on other webpages.

zeljkazorz@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T14:12:55.000Z ##

Apple has backported the patch for CVE-2024-23296 to the iOS 16 branch and has fixed a bug (CVE-2024-27852) in MarketplaceKit that may allow maliciously crafted webpages to distribute a script that tracks iOS users on other webpages.

The company has also added a new capability to iOS 17 that will alert users if an unknown Bluetooth tracker is “seen” moving with them.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/14/ios-bluetooth-tracker-alert/

@mysk #Apple #iOS #Privacy #Tracking

CVE-2023-52656(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-14T15:33:04

2 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: io_uring: drop any code related to SCM_RIGHTS This is dead code after we dropped support for passing io_uring fds over SCM_RIGHTS, get rid of it.

CVE-2008-0166
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 9.86%

updated 2024-05-14T01:50:09.780000

2 posts

OpenSSL 0.9.8c-1 up to versions before 0.9.8g-9 on Debian-based operating systems uses a random number generator that generates predictable numbers, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct brute force guessing attacks against cryptographic keys.

4 repos

https://github.com/badkeys/debianopenssl

https://github.com/avarx/vulnkeys

https://github.com/g0tmi1k/debian-ssh

https://github.com/demining/Vulnerable-to-Debian-OpenSSL-bug-CVE-2008-0166

vorlon@mastodon.social at 2024-05-15T23:21:33.000Z ##

Ahahaha happy 16th birthday to CVE-2008-0166, still going strong
https://infosec.exchange/@briankrebs/112428503842956186

##
jbzfn@mastodon.social at 2024-05-15T10:15:00.000Z ##

🌀 16 years of CVE-2008-0166 - Debian OpenSSL Bug
— 16years.secvuln.info

"A patch in Debian's and Ubuntu's OpenSSL packages broke the random number generator, effectively limiting the number of possible keys to a few ten thousand plausible variations"

https://16years.secvuln.info/

#debian #openssl #CVE20080166 #infosec #linux #opensource

##

CVE-2023-6549
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.60%

updated 2024-05-10T18:15:07.670000

1 posts

Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer in NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway allows Unauthenticated Denial of Service and Out-Of-Bounds Memory Read

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T15:36:25.000Z ##

Citrix security advisory update: NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Security Bulletin for CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549
Following Bishop Fox's blog post about an unassigned OOB Memory Read vulnerability affecting Netscaler ADC and Gateway (see parent toot above), Citrix updates their security advisory for CVE-2023-6549 (8.2 high, disclosed 16 January 2024 by Citrix, added to CISA's KEV Catalog on 17 January 2024). Originally a buffer overflow vulnerability in NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway leading to denial of service (DoS), it now includes the verbiage "Out-Of-Bounds Memory Read".

cc: @todb @ntkramer

#CVE_2023_6549 #Citrix #vulnerability #Netscaler #CitrixADC

##

CVE-2024-4559(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-07T21:31:53

1 posts

Heap buffer overflow in WebAudio in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.155 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-14T13:23:23.000Z ##

I feel the need to point out that with this update, Opera went to Chromium "124.0.6367.62"… yes you read that right ".62" which is a build long before both recent 0-day exploits (it is from last month).

To be clear, Opera is not faster at responding to the CVE-2024-4761 0-day than Edge or Brave (or Chrome and Vivaldi obviously), it is much, much slower. Unless they have backported security fixes and their Changelog gives no indication of that https://blogs.opera.com/desktop/changelog-for-110/ , they are missing all of the following security improvements

• High CVE-2024-4761: Out of bounds write in V8 [0-day exploit in the wild]
• High CVE-2024-4671: Use after free in Visuals [0-day exploit in the wild]
• High CVE-2024-4558: Use after free in ANGLE
• High CVE-2024-4559: Heap buffer overflow in WebAudio
• High CVE-2024-4331: Use after free in Picture In Picture
• High CVE-2024-4368: Use after free in Dawn
• Critical CVE-2024-4058: Type Confusion in ANGLE
• High CVE-2024-4059: Out of bounds read in V8 API
• High CVE-2024-4060: Use after free in Dawn

#CVE_2024_4761 #CVE_2024_4671 #Chrome #OperaBrowser #OperaWebBrowser #ZeroDay

CVE-2024-3302(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-04T05:02:40

1 posts

There was no limit to the number of HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frames that would be processed. A server could abuse this to create an Out of Memory condition in the browser. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125 and Firefox ESR < 115.10.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T19:07:45.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet: 21 new vulnerabilities (no mention of exploitation) across 18 advisories:

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put
  • FG-IR-23-433 CVE-2023-50180 (5.5 medium) Exposure of password hashes to read-only admin
  • FG-IR-23-137 Format String Bug in cli command
    • CVE-2023-36640 (6.7 medium)
    • CVE-2023-45583 (6.7 medium)
  • FG-IR-23-465 CVE-2024-23664 (6.1 medium) FortiAuthenticator - Open Redirect on /portal/disclaimer
  • FG-IR-24-120 HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Frames Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-27316 for Apache HTTP Server (httpd)
    • CVE-2024-24549 for Apache Tomcat
    • CVE-2024-30255 for Envoy proxy (nghttp2)
    • CVE-2023-45288 for Golang
    • CVE-2024-28182 for nghttp2
    • CVE-2024-27983 for Node.js
    • CVE-2024-3302 for Firefox
  • FG-IR-23-282 CVE-2023-40720 (7.1 high) IDOR over SIP configuration file
  • FG-IR-24-052 CVE-2024-31493 (6.5 medium) Information disclosure in content hub
  • FG-IR-23-222 Multiple improper input validation and authorization vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-23667 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23668 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23669 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23670 (8.8 high)
  • FG-IR-24-017 CVE-2024-26007 (5.3 medium) Node.js crash over administrative interface
  • FG-IR-23-191 CVE-2024-23107 (5.5 medium) Read only administrator can see passwords' hashes
  • FG-IR-24-054 CVE-2024-31491 (8.8 high) Readonly user could execute sensitive operations
  • FG-IR-23-225 CVE-2023-45586 (5.0 medium) SSL-VPN user IP spoofing
  • FG-IR-24-040 CVE-2024-31488 (6.8 medium) Stored and reflected XSS
  • FG-IR-23-474 CVE-2024-23665 (5.9 medium) Unauthorized ADOM operations

#Fortinet #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #FortiOS #HTTP2 #ContinuationFlood

CVE-2024-2961
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-04T01:15:06.243000

9 posts

The iconv() function in the GNU C Library versions 2.39 and older may overflow the output buffer passed to it by up to 4 bytes when converting strings to the ISO-2022-CN-EXT character set, which may be used to crash an application or overwrite a neighbouring variable.

3 repos

https://github.com/ambionics/cnext-exploits

https://github.com/rvizx/CVE-2024-2961

https://github.com/mattaperkins/FIX-CVE-2024-2961

techbrunchfr at 2024-05-27T20:33:09.853Z ##

Iconv, set the charset to RCE: Exploiting the glibc to hack the PHP engine (part 1) - https://www.ambionics.io/blog/iconv-cve-2024-2961-p1 #rce #php

##
hnbot@chrispelli.fun at 2024-05-27T16:34:31.000Z ##

#hackernews

##
technewz_bot@mastodon.metawarrior.army at 2024-05-27T16:01:34.000Z ##

Iconv, set the charset to RCE: Exploiting the glibc to hack the PHP engine
https://www.ambionics.io/blog/iconv-cve-2024-2961-p1
posted by #technewz_bot #tech #news

##
swapgs at 2024-05-27T10:04:53.669Z ##

The great @cfreal just released a detailed write-up of his glibc bug that he could exploit in PHP thanks to the iconv filter (CVE-2024-2961). This changes everything on vulnerable versions of PHP—most file read primitives now lead to RCE.

https://www.ambionics.io/blog/iconv-cve-2024-2961-p1

##

##

CVE-2024-4059(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-03T03:31:13

1 posts

Out of bounds read in V8 API in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.78 allowed a remote attacker to leak cross-site data via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-14T13:23:23.000Z ##

I feel the need to point out that with this update, Opera went to Chromium "124.0.6367.62"… yes you read that right ".62" which is a build long before both recent 0-day exploits (it is from last month).

To be clear, Opera is not faster at responding to the CVE-2024-4761 0-day than Edge or Brave (or Chrome and Vivaldi obviously), it is much, much slower. Unless they have backported security fixes and their Changelog gives no indication of that https://blogs.opera.com/desktop/changelog-for-110/ , they are missing all of the following security improvements

• High CVE-2024-4761: Out of bounds write in V8 [0-day exploit in the wild]
• High CVE-2024-4671: Use after free in Visuals [0-day exploit in the wild]
• High CVE-2024-4558: Use after free in ANGLE
• High CVE-2024-4559: Heap buffer overflow in WebAudio
• High CVE-2024-4331: Use after free in Picture In Picture
• High CVE-2024-4368: Use after free in Dawn
• Critical CVE-2024-4058: Type Confusion in ANGLE
• High CVE-2024-4059: Out of bounds read in V8 API
• High CVE-2024-4060: Use after free in Dawn

#CVE_2024_4761 #CVE_2024_4671 #Chrome #OperaBrowser #OperaWebBrowser #ZeroDay

CVE-2023-45288
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-02T18:59:06

1 posts

An attacker may cause an HTTP/2 endpoint to read arbitrary amounts of header data by sending an excessive number of CONTINUATION frames. Maintaining HPACK state requires parsing and processing all HEADERS and CONTINUATION frames on a connection. When a request's headers exceed MaxHeaderBytes, no memory is allocated to store the excess headers, but they are still parsed. This permits an attacker to

CVE-2024-4324
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-02T18:00:37.360000

2 posts

The WP Video Lightbox plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘width’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.9.10 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an i

screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T14:47:21.901Z ##

Aqua Security: Linguistic Lumberjack: Understanding CVE-2024-4323 in Fluent Bit
Aqua provides an overview of the Linguistic Lumberjack vulnerability CVE-2024-4323 (see parent toot above for security advisory and CVE details). Fluent Bit is a highly popular open-source data collector and processor designed for handling large volumes of log data from various sources, and is supposedly used by all major cloud providers.
The flaw is due to improper validation of input names in requests, which can be exploited to cause memory corruption. This can result in denial-of-service attacks or information exposure, with remote code execution being possible under certain conditions.
Aqua's investigation reports that the built-in http server needs to be exposed to the internet in order for Fluent Bit to be vulnerable, and that 20 versions from various popular open source tools on Docker Hub had http turned off by default.
Aqua recommends upgrading Fluent Bit to the fixed version 3.0.4.

#LinguisticLumberjack #CVE_2024_4324 #CVE #vulnerability #FluentBit

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-25T14:47:21.000Z ##

Aqua Security: Linguistic Lumberjack: Understanding CVE-2024-4323 in Fluent Bit
Aqua provides an overview of the Linguistic Lumberjack vulnerability CVE-2024-4323 (see parent toot above for security advisory and CVE details). Fluent Bit is a highly popular open-source data collector and processor designed for handling large volumes of log data from various sources, and is supposedly used by all major cloud providers.
The flaw is due to improper validation of input names in requests, which can be exploited to cause memory corruption. This can result in denial-of-service attacks or information exposure, with remote code execution being possible under certain conditions.
Aqua's investigation reports that the built-in http server needs to be exposed to the internet in order for Fluent Bit to be vulnerable, and that 20 versions from various popular open source tools on Docker Hub had http turned off by default.
Aqua recommends upgrading Fluent Bit to the fixed version 3.0.4.

#LinguisticLumberjack #CVE_2024_4324 #CVE #vulnerability #FluentBit

CVE-2024-27316(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-01T18:31:15

1 posts

HTTP/2 incoming headers exceeding the limit are temporarily buffered in nghttp2 in order to generate an informative HTTP 413 response. If a client does not stop sending headers, this leads to memory exhaustion.

CVE-2024-30255
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-01T18:15:19.723000

1 posts

Envoy is a cloud-native, open source edge and service proxy. The HTTP/2 protocol stack in Envoy versions prior to 1.29.3, 1.28.2, 1.27.4, and 1.26.8 are vulnerable to CPU exhaustion due to flood of CONTINUATION frames. Envoy's HTTP/2 codec allows the client to send an unlimited number of CONTINUATION frames even after exceeding Envoy's header map limits. This allows an attacker to send a sequence

pgjdbc, the PostgreSQL JDBC Driver, allows attacker to inject SQL if using PreferQueryMode=SIMPLE. Note this is not the default. In the default mode there is no vulnerability. A placeholder for a numeric value must be immediately preceded by a minus. There must be a second placeholder for a string value after the first placeholder; both must be on the same line. ##

CVE-2024-1086
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-01T18:15:13.200000

6 posts

A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tables component can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. The nft_verdict_init() function allows positive values as drop error within the hook verdict, and hence the nf_hook_slow() function can cause a double free vulnerability when NF_DROP is issued with a drop error which resembles NF_ACCEPT. We recommend upgradi

3 repos

https://github.com/Notselwyn/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/CCIEVoice2009/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/Alicey0719/docker-POC_CVE-2024-1086

screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T15:07:36.662Z ##

Currently top trending vulnerability on Twitter according to CVE Trends:
CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high, disclosed 30 January 2024 by Google, Proof of Concept and vulnerability details available) Linux Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability, working on most Linux kernels between v5.14 and v6.6, including Debian, Ubuntu, and KernelCTF.

Due to a use-after-free vulnerability in the netfilter: nf_tables component of the Linux kernel, the nft_verdict_init() function allows the use of positive values as a drop error in the hook verdict. When NF_DROP issues a drop error similar to NF_ACCEPT, the nf_hook_slow() function could lead to a double-free vulnerability. Local attackers could exploit this flaw to elevate privileges from a regular user to root.

There's an amusing shitpost "No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens courtesy of @cadey

#CVE_2024_1086 #Linux #CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-25T15:07:36.000Z ##

Currently top trending vulnerability on Twitter according to CVE Trends:
CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high, disclosed 30 January 2024 by Google, Proof of Concept and vulnerability details available) Linux Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability, working on most Linux kernels between v5.14 and v6.6, including Debian, Ubuntu, and KernelCTF.

Due to a use-after-free vulnerability in the netfilter: nf_tables component of the Linux kernel, the nft_verdict_init() function allows the use of positive values as a drop error in the hook verdict. When NF_DROP issues a drop error similar to NF_ACCEPT, the nf_hook_slow() function could lead to a double-free vulnerability. Local attackers could exploit this flaw to elevate privileges from a regular user to root.

There's an amusing shitpost "No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens courtesy of @cadey

#CVE_2024_1086 #Linux #CVE #vulnerability

DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T15:20:06.000Z ##

🚨POC RELEASED🚨PoC for WordPress Auto Admin Account Creation and Reverse Shell CVE-2024-27956. GitHub in X Link.

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec #Exploit #Wordpress #CVE202427956

Details:

This Python script automates the process of creating a new administrator account in a WordPress site and executing a reverse shell on the target server. It utilizes the wp-automatic plugin's CSV injection vulnerability to execute SQL queries on the WordPress database and gain administrative access.

X Link: https://twitter.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1790400822511280334

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T19:41:36.000Z ##

Volexity: Detecting Compromise of CVE-2024-3400 on Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect Devices
Volexity provided additional information about the compromises surrounding CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day).
After Palo Alto Networks' security advisory went public, scanning and exploitation of the vulnerability immediately increased. Volexity assesses it was by UTA0218 or another threat actor that had early access to the exploit prior to proof-of-concept code being made public. Multiple organizations were exploited in late March 2024 but only to place 0-byte files on their systems (validating exploitability). Exfiltration of the firewall’s running configuration was the most commonly observed post-exploitation activity across devices spanning numerous verticals and geographic regions.
Volexity provides detection and validation techniques for compromised Palo Alto Network firewalls, including memory analysis if available. No additional IOC.

Note: this is the latest reply in a whole chain of toots related to CVE-2024-3400.

#CVE_2024_3400 #PaloAltoNetworks #eitw #threatintel #activeexploitation #DFIR #UTA0218

CVE-2024-20693
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-09T18:30:25

2 posts

Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

xnyhps at 2024-05-23T08:52:43.412Z ##

Reporting issues in Windows. 🤡

* August, 25, 2023: Issue reported to MSRC.
…
* April 9, 2024: Fix released as CVE-2024-20693.
* April 25, 2024: MSRC asks Microsoft Bounty Team for an update, CCing us.
* April 26, 2024: Microsoft Bounty Team sends back a boilerplate reply that the case is under review.
* May 17, 2024: MSRC asks Microsoft Bounty Team for an update, CCing us again.
* May 22, 2024: Microsoft Bounty Team replies that the vulnerability is out of scope for a bounty, claiming it wasn’t reproduced on the right WIP build.

#Microsoft #MSRC

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-20T15:30:02.000Z ##

CVE-2023-34992: Fortinet FortiSIEM Command Injection Deep-Dive – Source: securityboulevard.com https://ciso2ciso.com/cve-2023-34992-fortinet-fortisiem-command-injection-deep-dive-source-securityboulevard-com/ #rssfeedpostgeneratorecho #SecurityBloggersNetwork #CyberSecurityNews #SecurityBoulevard #Disclosures

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-20T12:18:06.747Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2023-34992: Fortinet FortiSIEM Command Injection Deep-Dive
Horizon3 provides a vulnerability analysis and proof of concept for CVE-2023-34992 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 October 2023 by Fortinet) OS Command injection vulnerability in FortiSIEM supervisor due to improper neutralization of special elements.

Sidenote: This is the same 23 October 2023 security advisory that Fortinet buried two additional vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 have a perfect score of 10.0 cc: @cR0w) on 06 February 2024. When @serghei of Bleeping Computer asked about it, "Fortinet told me these two are duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992. Fortinet says they got accidentally added and pushed to NVD automatically because of an API issue they're investigating."
Zach Hanley (who submitted all of these vulnerabilities and Horizon3's blog post) disputed what Fortinet said, posting a Twitter screenshot showing email communication between him and PSIRT Ticketing* System showing confirmation for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109: "Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to."
Fortinet then updated the security advisory sometime around 08-09 February 2024, crediting Zach Hanley/Horizon3 and backdating the update to 31 January 2024.

as @catsalad said in a previous toot, recommend temporary fix is to "Just pull the power"

#CVE_2023_34992 #proofofconcept #CVE #Fortinet #vulnerability #fortisiem

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T12:18:06.000Z ##

Fortinet says they got accidentally added and pushed to NVD automatically because of an API issue they're investigating."
Zach Hanley (who submitted all of these vulnerabilities and Horizon3's blog post) disputed what Fortinet said, posting a Twitter screenshot showing email communication between him and PSIRT Ticketing* System showing confirmation for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109: "Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to."

CVE-2024-23296

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-03-14T00:31:04

2 posts

A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4. An attacker with arbitrary kernel read and write capability may be able to bypass kernel memory protections. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.

avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T15:22:11.000Z ##

Apple also back ported a #security fix for older iOS versions (16), which is a flaw (CVE-2024-23296) in RTKit that “may have been exploited in the wild.”

The updated version for the older #iOS versions is 16.7.8. This was already patched by #Apple on iOS 17.4 released in MAR 24.

#cve #cybersecurity

##
zeljkazorz@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T14:12:55.000Z ##

Apple has backported the patch for CVE-2024-23296 to the iOS 16 branch and has fixed a bug (CVE-2024-27852) in MarketplaceKit that may allow maliciously crafted webpages to distribute a script that tracks iOS users on other webpages.

The company has also added a new capability to iOS 17 that will alert users if an unknown Bluetooth tracker is “seen” moving with them.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/14/ios-bluetooth-tracker-alert/

CVE-2023-6246
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.77%

updated 2024-02-16T13:15:10.023000

2 posts

A heap-based buffer overflow was found in the __vsyslog_internal function of the glibc library. This function is called by the syslog and vsyslog functions. This issue occurs when the openlog function was not called, or called with the ident argument set to NULL, and the program name (the basename of argv[0]) is bigger than 1024 bytes, resulting in an application crash or local privilege escalatio

Nuclei template

1 repos

https://github.com/elpe-pinillo/CVE-2023-6246

screaminggoat at 2024-05-23T15:08:27.128Z ##

elpe_pinillo: HEAP HEAP HOORAY — Unveiling GLIBC heap overflow vulnerability (CVE-2023–6246)
elpe_pinillo provides a vulnerability analysis of CVE-2023–6246 (CNA 8.4 high, NVD 7.8, disclosed 29 January 2024 by Red Hat) heap-based buffer overflow in the glibc library. They describe heap overflows, "Heap Feng Shui" (a real memory exploitation technique), and arriving at an exploit for CVE-2023_6246. h/t: @0xor0ne

#CVE_2023_6246 #glibc #vulnerability #CVE

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-17T13:10:31.000Z ##

This is a guest post by Deepfense. It references CVE-2024-23917, CVE-2024-27198, and CVE-2024-27199

#cybersecurity #infosec

Vulnerability management lessons from the #JetBrains security incident https://www.securityinfowatch.com/cybersecurity/article/55040510/vulnerability-management-lessons-from-the-jetbrains-security-incident

##

CVE-2024-23109
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-02-05T15:30:29

2 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-20T12:18:06.747Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2023-34992: Fortinet FortiSIEM Command Injection Deep-Dive
Horizon3 provides a vulnerability analysis and proof of concept for CVE-2023-34992 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 October 2023 by Fortinet) OS Command injection vulnerability in FortiSIEM supervisor due to improper neutralization of special elements.

Sidenote: This is the same 23 October 2023 security advisory that Fortinet buried two additional vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 have a perfect score of 10.0 cc: @cR0w) on 06 February 2024. When @serghei of Bleeping Computer asked about it, "Fortinet told me these two are duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992. Fortinet says they got accidentally added and pushed to NVD automatically because of an API issue they're investigating."
Zach Hanley (who submitted all of these vulnerabilities and Horizon3's blog post) disputed what Fortinet said, posting a Twitter screenshot showing email communication between him and PSIRT Ticketing* System showing confirmation for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109: "Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to."
Fortinet then updated the security advisory sometime around 08-09 February 2024, crediting Zach Hanley/Horizon3 and backdating the update to 31 January 2024.

as @catsalad said in a previous toot, recommend temporary fix is to "Just pull the power"

#CVE_2023_34992 #proofofconcept #CVE #Fortinet #vulnerability #fortisiem

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T12:18:06.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2023-34992: Fortinet FortiSIEM Command Injection Deep-Dive
Horizon3 provides a vulnerability analysis and proof of concept for CVE-2023-34992 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 October 2023 by Fortinet) OS Command injection vulnerability in FortiSIEM supervisor due to improper neutralization of special elements.

Sidenote: This is the same 23 October 2023 security advisory that Fortinet buried two additional vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 have a perfect score of 10.0 cc: @cR0w) on 06 February 2024. When @serghei of Bleeping Computer asked about it, "Fortinet told me these two are duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992. Fortinet says they got accidentally added and pushed to NVD automatically because of an API issue they're investigating."
Zach Hanley (who submitted all of these vulnerabilities and Horizon3's blog post) disputed what Fortinet said, posting a Twitter screenshot showing email communication between him and PSIRT Ticketing* System showing confirmation for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109: "Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to."
Fortinet then updated the security advisory sometime around 08-09 February 2024, crediting Zach Hanley/Horizon3 and backdating the update to 31 January 2024.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-20T12:18:06.747Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2023-34992: Fortinet FortiSIEM Command Injection Deep-Dive
Horizon3 provides a vulnerability analysis and proof of concept for CVE-2023-34992 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 October 2023 by Fortinet) OS Command injection vulnerability in FortiSIEM supervisor due to improper neutralization of special elements.

Sidenote: This is the same 23 October 2023 security advisory that Fortinet buried two additional vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 have a perfect score of 10.0 cc: @cR0w) on 06 February 2024. When @serghei of Bleeping Computer asked about it, "Fortinet told me these two are duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992. Fortinet says they got accidentally added and pushed to NVD automatically because of an API issue they're investigating."
Zach Hanley (who submitted all of these vulnerabilities and Horizon3's blog post) disputed what Fortinet said, posting a Twitter screenshot showing email communication between him and PSIRT Ticketing* System showing confirmation for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109: "Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to."
Fortinet then updated the security advisory sometime around 08-09 February 2024, crediting Zach Hanley/Horizon3 and backdating the update to 31 January 2024.

Horizon3: CVE-2023-34992: Fortinet FortiSIEM Command Injection Deep-Dive
Horizon3 provides a vulnerability analysis and proof of concept for CVE-2023-34992 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 October 2023 by Fortinet) OS Command injection vulnerability in FortiSIEM supervisor due to improper neutralization of special elements.

Sidenote: This is the same 23 October 2023 security advisory that Fortinet buried two additional vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 have a perfect score of 10.0 cc: @cR0w) on 06 February 2024. When @serghei of Bleeping Computer asked about it, "Fortinet told me these two are duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992. Fortinet says they got accidentally added and pushed to NVD automatically because of an API issue they're investigating."
Zach Hanley (who submitted all of these vulnerabilities and Horizon3's blog post) disputed what Fortinet said, posting a Twitter screenshot showing email communication between him and PSIRT Ticketing* System showing confirmation for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109: "Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to."

CVE-2024-0402
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-01-26T03:30:25

2 posts

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 16.0 prior to 16.6.6, 16.7 prior to 16.7.4, and 16.8 prior to 16.8.1 which allows an authenticated user to write files to arbitrary locations on the GitLab server while creating a workspace.

swapgs at 2024-05-25T21:39:51.170Z ##

@buherator You mean this one? https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-0402
In that case it’s a differential between Ruby and Go, not Go and Rust!

(and thanks again for relaying such content here)

##

CVE-2023-6548
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.57%

updated 2024-01-25T16:45:58.287000

1 posts

Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection') in NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway allows an attacker with access to NSIP, CLIP or SNIP with management interface to perform Authenticated (low privileged) remote code execution on Management Interface.

1 repos

https://github.com/Roonye660/CVE-2023-6548-POC

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T15:36:25.000Z ##

Citrix security advisory update: NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Security Bulletin for CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549
Following Bishop Fox's blog post about an unassigned OOB Memory Read vulnerability affecting Netscaler ADC and Gateway (see parent toot above), Citrix updates their security advisory for CVE-2023-6549 (8.2 high, disclosed 16 January 2024 by Citrix, added to CISA's KEV Catalog on 17 January 2024). Originally a buffer overflow vulnerability in NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway leading to denial of service (DoS), it now includes the verbiage "Out-Of-Bounds Memory Read".

cc: @todb @ntkramer

#CVE_2023_6549 #Citrix #vulnerability #Netscaler #CitrixADC

screaminggoat at 2024-05-23T14:10:28.389Z ##

Unit 42: Operation Diplomatic Specter: An Active Chinese Cyberespionage Campaign Leverages Rare Tool Set to Target Governmental Entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia
Unit 42 reports on a Chinese APT (TGR-STA-0043) conducting an ongoing campaign (called Operation Diplomatic Specter) targeting political entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia since at least late 2022. An analysis of this threat actor’s activity reveals long-term espionage operations against at least seven governmental entities. The threat actor performed intelligence collection efforts at a large scale, leveraging rare email exfiltration techniques against compromised servers. Their collection efforts are on geopolitical affairs: diplomatic/economic missions, embassies, military operations, political meetings, ministries, and high ranking officials. This includes two new backdoors, called TunnelSpecter and SweetSpecter. Microsoft Exchange vulnerabilities CVE-2021-26855 (ProxyLogon) and CVE-2021-34473 (ProxyShell) are used for initial access. There’s a lot of information about motivation, victimology, malware analyses, attribution, overlaps with other Chinese threat actors, etc. IOC provided.

#threatintel #cyberespionage #TGRSTA0043 #China #IOC #OperationDiplomaticSpecter #CVE_2021_26855 #CVE_2021_34473 #ProxyLogon #ProxyShell

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-23T14:10:28.000Z ##

Unit 42: Operation Diplomatic Specter: An Active Chinese Cyberespionage Campaign Leverages Rare Tool Set to Target Governmental Entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia
Unit 42 reports on a Chinese APT (TGR-STA-0043) conducting an ongoing campaign (called Operation Diplomatic Specter) targeting political entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia since at least late 2022. An analysis of this threat actor’s activity reveals long-term espionage operations against at least seven governmental entities. The threat actor performed intelligence collection efforts at a large scale, leveraging rare email exfiltration techniques against compromised servers. Their collection efforts are on geopolitical affairs: diplomatic/economic missions, embassies, military operations, political meetings, ministries, and high ranking officials. This includes two new backdoors, called TunnelSpecter and SweetSpecter. Microsoft Exchange vulnerabilities CVE-2021-26855 (ProxyLogon) and CVE-2021-34473 (ProxyShell) are used for initial access. There’s a lot of information about motivation, victimology, malware analyses, attribution, overlaps with other Chinese threat actors, etc. IOC provided.

#threatintel #cyberespionage #TGRSTA0043 #China #IOC #OperationDiplomaticSpecter #CVE_2021_26855 #CVE_2021_34473 #ProxyLogon #ProxyShell

##

CVE-2020-17159
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.12%

updated 2024-01-07T05:05:37

2 posts

, aka 'Visual Studio Code Java Extension Pack Remote Code Execution Vulnerability'.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T12:40:33.171Z ##

@reverseics It looks like the root cause of CVE-2020-17159 is your favorite Common Weakness Enumeration: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') ../../../../etc/passwd
Here is the reporter's vulnerability analysis: https://www.vicarius.io/vsociety/posts/cve-2020-17519-apache-flink-directory-traversal-vulnerability

Unit 42 observed the CVE-2020-17159 exploit in the wild around 21 April 2021: https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/network-attack-trends-winter-2020/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-24T12:40:33.000Z ##

@reverseics It looks like the root cause of CVE-2020-17159 is your favorite Common Weakness Enumeration: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') ../../../../etc/passwd
Here is the reporter's vulnerability analysis: https://www.vicarius.io/vsociety/posts/cve-2020-17519-apache-flink-directory-traversal-vulnerability

Unit 42 observed the CVE-2020-17159 exploit in the wild around 21 April 2021: https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/network-attack-trends-winter-2020/

Unit 42: Operation Diplomatic Specter: An Active Chinese Cyberespionage Campaign Leverages Rare Tool Set to Target Governmental Entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia
Unit 42 reports on a Chinese APT (TGR-STA-0043) conducting an ongoing campaign (called Operation Diplomatic Specter) targeting political entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia since at least late 2022. An analysis of this threat actor’s activity reveals long-term espionage operations against at least seven governmental entities. The threat actor performed intelligence collection efforts at a large scale, leveraging rare email exfiltration techniques against compromised servers. Their collection efforts are on geopolitical affairs: diplomatic/economic missions, embassies, military operations, political meetings, ministries, and high ranking officials. This includes two new backdoors, called TunnelSpecter and SweetSpecter. Microsoft Exchange vulnerabilities CVE-2021-26855 (ProxyLogon) and CVE-2021-34473 (ProxyShell) are used for initial access. There’s a lot of information about motivation, victimology, malware analyses, attribution, overlaps with other Chinese threat actors, etc. IOC provided.

##

CVE-2018-11776
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.52%

updated 2024-01-05T15:59:40

2 posts

Apache Struts contains a Remote Code Execution when using results with no namespace and it's upper actions have no or wildcard namespace. The same flaw exists when using a url tag with no value, action set, and it's upper actions have no or wildcard namespace.

20 repos

https://github.com/649/Apache-Struts-Shodan-Exploit

https://github.com/bhdresh/CVE-2018-11776

https://github.com/ArunBhandarii/Apache-Struts-0Day-Exploit

https://github.com/Ekultek/Strutter

https://github.com/jiguangsdf/CVE-2018-11776

https://github.com/xfox64x/CVE-2018-11776

https://github.com/gh0st27/Struts2Scanner

https://github.com/brianwrf/S2-057-CVE-2018-11776

https://github.com/tuxotron/cve-2018-11776-docker

https://github.com/Fnzer0/S2-057-poc

https://github.com/cved-sources/cve-2018-11776

https://github.com/jezzus/CVE-2018-11776-Python-PoC

https://github.com/OzNetNerd/apche-struts-vuln-demo-cve-2018-11776

https://github.com/hook-s3c/CVE-2018-11776-Python-PoC

https://github.com/HxDDD/CVE-PoC

https://github.com/mazen160/struts-pwn_CVE-2018-11776

https://github.com/knqyf263/CVE-2018-11776

https://github.com/sonpt-afk/CVE-2018-11776-FIS

https://github.com/cucadili/CVE-2018-11776

https://github.com/freshdemo/ApacheStruts-CVE-2018-11776

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-05-23T10:10:05.000Z ##

Apache Struts2 CVE-2018-11776

Learn about the Struts2 Remote Code Execution vulnerability CVE-2018-11776, how to exploit and how to create a Proof of Concept (POC) with docker.

🔗️ [Secjuice] https://link.is.it/l80ej5

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-05-23T10:10:05.000Z ##

Apache Struts2 CVE-2018-11776

##

CVE-2023-36033
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-11-20T19:53:39.690000

3 posts

Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T21:03:30.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots The five alarm fire is definitely CVE-2024-30051 for sure. Kaspersky states that they discovered an exploitation guide regarding a Windows Desktop Window Manager (DWM) vulnerability uploaded to VirusTotal. And while the described exploitation process is identical to CVE-2023-36033, the vulnerability was different (new): https://securelist.com/cve-2024-30051/112618/

We have seen it used together with QakBot and other malware, and believe that multiple threat actors have access to it.

In your blog post, I think it ought to be mentioned that CVE-2024-30046 is only considered a zero-day because it's marked Publicly Disclosed. https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-30046

#CVE_2024_30051 #CVE_2024_30046 #PatchTuesday #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T17:23:03.000Z ##

Kaspersky writes a related blog post about one of the zero-days: QakBot attacks with Windows zero-day (CVE-2024-30051)
The blog post details how a document uploaded to VirusTotal on 01 April 2024 described an exploitation process for Windows Desktop Window Manager (DWM) identical to CVE-2023-36033 but with a different vulnerability. Kaspersky identified that an exploit was used together with QakBot and other malware, and believe that multiple threat actors have access to it.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @mttaggart @deepthoughts10

#CVE_2024_30051 #PatchTuesday #eitw #vulnerability #zeroday #activeexploitation #Microsoft #MSRC

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-05-14T17:20:25.000Z ##

In April 2024, while researching CVE-2023-36033, we discovered another zero-day elevation-of-privilege vulnerability, which was assigned...

##

CVE-2021-44228
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.56%

updated 2023-11-07T03:39:36.897000

1 posts

Apache Log4j2 2.0-beta9 through 2.15.0 (excluding security releases 2.12.2, 2.12.3, and 2.3.1) JNDI features used in configuration, log messages, and parameters do not protect against attacker controlled LDAP and other JNDI related endpoints. An attacker who can control log messages or log message parameters can execute arbitrary code loaded from LDAP servers when message lookup substitution is en

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-16T14:34:19.000Z ##

Uptycs: New Threat Detected: Inside Our Discovery of the Log4j Campaign and Its XMRig Malware
Unknown financially-motivated threat actors have been exploiting Log4Shell CVE-2021-44228 (10.0 critical, disclosed 10 December 2021 by Apache as an exploited zero-day in Log4j 2) to deploy XMRig cryptominers since January 2024. Affected countries include China (top), followed by Hong Kong, Netherlands, Japan, United States, Germany, South Africa, and Sweden. Four distinct sets of servers establish communication with compromised IP and send shell scripts for XMRig deployment, or disseminating Mirai or Gafgyt malware. IOC provided.

#threatintel #CVE_2021_44228 #Log4Shell #Log4j #IOC #XMrig #mirai #gafgyt

##

CVE-2023-28450
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.24%

updated 2023-04-17T03:30:19

4 posts

An issue was discovered in Dnsmasq before 2.90. The default maximum EDNS.0 UDP packet size was set to 4096 but should be 1232 because of DNS Flag Day 2020.

ondrej@sury.org at 2024-05-27T14:39:34.000Z ##

@bortzmeyer This is absolutely absurd, the security should not be a Pokémon:

Industry-wide: CVE-2024-33655
Knot: CVE-2023-49206
Simple DNS Plus: CVE-2023-49205
Technitium: CVE-2023-28456 CVE-2023-49203
MaraDNS: CVE-2023-49204
Dnsmasq: CVE-2023-28450 CVE-2023-49207
CoreDNS: CVE-2023-28454 CVE-2023-49202
SDNS: CVE-2023-49201

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-21T16:32:54.420Z ##

DNSBomb has a website!: https://dnsbomb.net/ h/t: @shellsharks Assigned vulnerabilities associated with it:

  • Industry-wide: CVE-2024-33655
  • Knot: CVE-2023-49206
  • Simple DNS Plus: CVE-2023-49205
  • Technitium:
    • CVE-2023-28456
    • CVE-2023-49203
  • MaraDNS: CVE-2023-49204
  • Dnsmasq:
    • CVE-2023-28450 (7.5 high) An issue was discovered in Dnsmasq before 2.90. The default maximum EDNS.0 UDP packet size was set to 4096 but should be 1232 because of DNS Flag Day 2020.
    • CVE-2023-49207
  • CoreDNS:
    • CVE-2023-28454
    • CVE-2023-49202
  • SDNS: CVE-2023-49201

#DoS #DNSBomb

##

CVE-2018-5158
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.95%

updated 2023-02-02T05:03:34

2 posts

The PDF viewer does not sufficiently sanitize PostScript calculator functions, allowing malicious JavaScript to be injected through a crafted PDF file. This JavaScript can then be run with the permissions of the PDF viewer by its worker. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 52.8 and Firefox < 60.

2 repos

https://github.com/ppcrab/CVE-2018-5158

https://github.com/puzzle-tools/-CVE-2018-5158.pdf

WPalant at 2024-05-20T13:21:30.919Z ##

@screaminggoat Oh, just great… I noted the dangerous glyph handling in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1452075 a.k.a. CVE-2018-5158 six years ago. Not immediately obvious whether the checks added to compileGlyph back then were insufficient or degraded over time due to refactoring. 🙄

##
WPalant@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T13:21:30.000Z ##

@screaminggoat Oh, just great… I noted the dangerous glyph handling in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1452075 a.k.a. CVE-2018-5158 six years ago. Not immediately obvious whether the checks added to compileGlyph back then were insufficient or degraded over time due to refactoring. 🙄

EPSS: 0.36%

2 posts

Trustwave ModSecurity 3.0.0 through 3.0.3 allows an attacker to send crafted requests that may, when sent quickly in large volumes, lead to the server becoming slow or unresponsive (Denial of Service) because of a flaw in Transaction::addRequestHeader in transaction.cc.

CVE-2021-30563
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.37%

updated 2021-08-09T16:43:29.630000

1 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 91.0.4472.164 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T22:59:57.000Z ##

@ligniform yeah, previous Type Confusion in V8 based Chromium vulnerabilities were present in Edge e.g. CVE-2021-30563

The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based).

@ariadne What about CVE-2021-30139? That's essentially an out-of-bounds read and hence a spatial memory safety violation.

##

CVE-2019-0604
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.40%

updated 2019-12-13T15:17:16.560000

4 posts

A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Microsoft SharePoint when the software fails to check the source markup of an application package, aka 'Microsoft SharePoint Remote Code Execution Vulnerability'. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2019-0594.

8 repos

https://github.com/boxhg/CVE-2019-0604

https://github.com/m5050/CVE-2019-0604

https://github.com/Gh0st0ne/weaponized-0604

https://github.com/linhlhq/CVE-2019-0604

https://github.com/likescam/CVE-2019-0604_sharepoint_CVE

https://github.com/MayankPandey01/Sparty-2.0

https://github.com/davidlebr1/cve-2019-0604-SP2010-netv3.5

https://github.com/k8gege/CVE-2019-0604

screaminggoat at 2024-05-21T01:03:21.393Z ##

@campuscodi I think it's important to note that Scarred Manticore (aka OilRig, APT34, EUROPIUM, Hazel Sandstorm) was known to target CVE-2019-0604, a SharePoint (Server) RCE vulnerability in attacks on both Albania and Israel. If we were to build an APT threat actor profile, we can list this CVE as their preferred Exploit Public Facing Application of choice.

The language Check Point Research used implied that Scarred Manticore will pass off the final actions on objective (wiper/encryption/data destruction) to Void Manticore (aka Storm-0842) as the "closer."

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-20T11:58:51.442Z ##

Check Point Research: Bad Karma, No Justice: Void Manticore Destructive Activities In Israel
Check Point Research reports on the Iranian threat actor “Void Manticore” (aka Storm-0842) who they state is affiliated with the Ministry of Intelligence and Security (MOIS). Void Manticore operates several online personas, from Homeland Justice for attacks in Albania, and Karma for attacks carried out in Israel. Void Manticore utilizes five different methods to conduct disruptive operations against its victims. This includes several custom wipers for both Windows and Linux, alongside manual deletion of files and shared drives. Void Manticore and Scarred Manticore have target overlaps and there are indications of systematic hand off of targets between those two groups (Void handles the rest). IOC and Yara rules provided.

Check Point offhandedly mentioned that Scarred Manticore (aka OilRig, APT34, EUROPIUM, Hazel Sandstorm) exploits CVE-2019-0604 (9.8 critical, disclosed 12 February 2019 by Microsoft, added to CISA KEV 03 November 2021) Microsoft SharePoint Remote Code Execution for initial access.

#VoidManticore #cyberespionage #Iran #threatintel #Storm0842 #Oilrig #APT34 #IOC #Yara #CVE_2019_0604

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-21T01:03:21.000Z ##

@campuscodi I think it's important to note that Scarred Manticore (aka OilRig, APT34, EUROPIUM, Hazel Sandstorm) was known to target CVE-2019-0604, a SharePoint (Server) RCE vulnerability in attacks on both Albania and Israel. If we were to build an APT threat actor profile, we can list this CVE as their preferred Exploit Public Facing Application of choice.

The language Check Point Research used implied that Scarred Manticore will pass off the final actions on objective (wiper/encryption/data destruction) to Void Manticore (aka Storm-0842) as the "closer."

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T11:58:51.000Z ##

Check Point Research: Bad Karma, No Justice: Void Manticore Destructive Activities In Israel
Check Point Research reports on the Iranian threat actor “Void Manticore” (aka Storm-0842) who they state is affiliated with the Ministry of Intelligence and Security (MOIS). Void Manticore operates several online personas, from Homeland Justice for attacks in Albania, and Karma for attacks carried out in Israel. Void Manticore utilizes five different methods to conduct disruptive operations against its victims. This includes several custom wipers for both Windows and Linux, alongside manual deletion of files and shared drives. Void Manticore and Scarred Manticore have target overlaps and there are indications of systematic hand off of targets between those two groups (Void handles the rest). IOC and Yara rules provided.

Check Point offhandedly mentioned that Scarred Manticore (aka OilRig, APT34, EUROPIUM, Hazel Sandstorm) exploits CVE-2019-0604 (9.8 critical, disclosed 12 February 2019 by Microsoft, added to CISA KEV 03 November 2021) Microsoft SharePoint Remote Code Execution for initial access.

#VoidManticore #cyberespionage #Iran #threatintel #Storm0842 #Oilrig #APT34 #IOC #Yara #CVE_2019_0604

CVE-2024-5274
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

25 posts

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-24T09:25:03.000Z ##

Google Patches Fourth Chrome Zero-Day in Two Weeks https://www.securityweek.com/google-patches-fourth-chrome-zero-day-in-two-weeks/ #Vulnerabilities #vulnerability #CVE20245274 #Featured #ZeroDay #Chrome

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-24T09:25:03.000Z ##

Google Patches Fourth Chrome Zero-Day in Two Weeks https://www.securityweek.com/google-patches-fourth-chrome-zero-day-in-two-weeks/ #Vulnerabilities #vulnerability #CVE20245274 #Featured #ZeroDay #Chrome

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T17:38:59.578Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

#CVE_2024_5157 #CVE_2024_5158 #CVE_2024_5159 #CVE_2024_5160 #CVE_2024_5274 #vulnerability #CVE #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T11:16:12.127Z ##

Google Chrome zero-day: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
CVE-2024-5274 (high severity) Type Confusion in V8. Reported by Clément Lecigne of Google's Threat Analysis Group and Brendon Tiszka of Chrome Security on 2024-05-20

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

#zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_5274 #chrome #google

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-25T17:38:59.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

#CVE_2024_5157 #CVE_2024_5158 #CVE_2024_5159 #CVE_2024_5160 #CVE_2024_5274 #vulnerability #CVE #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-24T11:16:12.000Z ##
