Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-24T11:16:12.000Z ##

Google Chrome zero-day: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
CVE-2024-5274 (high severity) Type Confusion in V8. Reported by Clément Lecigne of Google's Threat Analysis Group and Brendon Tiszka of Chrome Security on 2024-05-20

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

#zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_5274 #chrome #google

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T04:45:58.614Z ##

@browserversiontracker For reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security

Microsoft has a fix for CVE-2024-5274 to Microsoft Edge Stable Channel (Version 125.0.2535.67), which has been reported by the Chromium team as having an exploit in the wild. For more information, see the Security Update Guide

The issue is that Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) didn’t create (or make live) the CVE-2024-5274 page at the time of publishing this message on 24 May 2024. cc: @ruario

##
beardedtechguy@allthingstech.social at 2024-05-24T16:54:08.000Z ##

This update includes a security fix from Chromium upstream to resolve “CVE-2024-5274: Type Confusion in V8”, an exploit for which exists in the wild.

Minor update (7) for Vivaldi Desktop Browser 6.7 https://vivaldi.com/blog/desktop/minor-update-seven-6-7/

#Vivaldi #Browser

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T15:23:28.780Z ##

@browserversiontracker For reference: https://blogs.opera.com/desktop/2024/05/opera-110-0-5130-39-stable-update/

Note: Opera referred to CVE-2024-5274 as a 0-day

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T14:40:09.913Z ##

@avoidthehack Vivaldi Desktop Browser, a Chromium-based web browser, version 6.7 "includes a security fix from Chromium upstream to resolve “CVE-2024-5274: Type Confusion in V8”, an exploit for which exists in the wild." https://vivaldi.com/blog/desktop/minor-update-seven-6-7/
cc: @ruario

##
avoidthehack at 2024-05-24T14:26:13.646Z ##

#Google fixes eighth actively exploited #Chrome zero-day this year

Another day, another 0 day in Chrome. It is another type confusion vulnerability in V8 (Chromium’s JavaScript engine). Evidence of active exploitation in the wild.

Tracked as CVE-2024-5274.

Affects #Chromium based web #browsers (not just Chrome), so maintained forks should be rolling updates ASAP.

#cve #cybersecurity #security #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/google-fixes-eighth-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-this-year/

##
jbhall56 at 2024-05-24T13:16:13.857Z ##

Assigned the CVE identifier CVE-2024-5274, the vulnerability relates to a type confusion bug in the V8 JavaScript and WebAssembly engine. It was reported by Clément Lecigne of Google's Threat Analysis Group and Brendon Tiszka of Chrome Security on May 20, 2024. https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/google-detects-4th-chrome-zero-day-in.html

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-24T08:20:05.000Z ##

Google fixes yet another Chrome zero-day exploited in the wild (CVE-2024-5274) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/24/cve-2024-5274/ #securityupdate #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #Vivaldi #Chrome #0-day #News #CVE

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-24T05:01:42.000Z ##

> I might expand on what that means later

So to expand. Yes it has a fix for “CVE-2024-5274: Type Confusion in V8” but I wanted to give Google a chance to release first. They did the work to fix this.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-22T16:12:48.229Z ##

Cisco security advisories. No mention of exploitation.

  • CVE-2024-20293 (5.8 medium) Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance and Firepower Threat Defense Software Inactive-to-Active ACL Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20363 (5.8 medium) Multiple Cisco Products Snort 3 HTTP Intrusion Prevention System Rule Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20261 (5.8 medium) Cisco Firepower Threat Defense Software Encrypted Archive File Policy Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-20239 (8.8 high) Cisco Firepower Management Center Software SQL Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20361 (5.8 medium) Cisco Firepower Management Center Software Object Group Access Control List Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20355 (5.0 medium) Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance and Firepower Threat Defense Software Authorization Bypass Vulnerability

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

CVE-2023-49203
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

ondrej@sury.org at 2024-05-27T14:39:34.000Z ##

@bortzmeyer This is absolutely absurd, the security should not be a Pokémon:

Industry-wide: CVE-2024-33655
Knot: CVE-2023-49206
Simple DNS Plus: CVE-2023-49205
Technitium: CVE-2023-28456 CVE-2023-49203
MaraDNS: CVE-2023-49204
Dnsmasq: CVE-2023-28450 CVE-2023-49207
CoreDNS: CVE-2023-28454 CVE-2023-49202
SDNS: CVE-2023-49201

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-21T16:32:54.420Z ##

DNSBomb has a website!: https://dnsbomb.net/ h/t: @shellsharks Assigned vulnerabilities associated with it:

  • Industry-wide: CVE-2024-33655
  • Knot: CVE-2023-49206
  • Simple DNS Plus: CVE-2023-49205
  • Technitium:
    • CVE-2023-28456
    • CVE-2023-49203
  • MaraDNS: CVE-2023-49204
  • Dnsmasq:
    • CVE-2023-28450 (7.5 high) An issue was discovered in Dnsmasq before 2.90. The default maximum EDNS.0 UDP packet size was set to 4096 but should be 1232 because of DNS Flag Day 2020.
    • CVE-2023-49207
  • CoreDNS:
    • CVE-2023-28454
    • CVE-2023-49202
  • SDNS: CVE-2023-49201

#DoS #DNSBomb

  • Industry-wide: CVE-2024-33655
  • Knot: CVE-2023-49206

  • Dnsmasq:
    • CVE-2023-28450 (7.5 high) An issue was discovered in Dnsmasq before 2.90. The default maximum EDNS.0 UDP packet size was set to 4096 but should be 1232 because of DNS Flag Day 2020.
    • CVE-2023-49207
  • CoreDNS:
    • CVE-2023-28454
    • CVE-2023-49202

  • MaraDNS: CVE-2023-49204
  • Dnsmasq:
    • CVE-2023-28450 (7.5 high) An issue was discovered in Dnsmasq before 2.90. The default maximum EDNS.0 UDP packet size was set to 4096 but should be 1232 because of DNS Flag Day 2020.
    • CVE-2023-49207
  • CoreDNS:
    • CVE-2023-28454
    • CVE-2023-49202
  • SDNS: CVE-2023-49201

#DoS #DNSBomb

obivan at 2024-05-27T13:00:44.985Z ##

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-05-21T20:17:52.000Z ##

Security researcher Amal Murali has published a PoC for CVE-2024-32002, an RCE in the Windows Git client that can be triggered via a simple git clone operation.

https://amalmurali.me/posts/git-rce/

https://github.blog/2024-05-14-securing-git-addressing-5-new-vulnerabilities/?ref=news.risky.biz

zeljkazorz at 2024-05-17T09:30:22.131Z ##

New versions of Git are out, with fixes for five vulnerabilities, the most critical (CVE-2024-32002) of which can be used by attackers to remotely execute code during a “clone” operation.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/16/git-cve-2024-32002/

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-16T11:50:06.000Z ##

Critical Git vulnerability allows RCE when cloning repositories with submodules (CVE-2024-32002) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/16/git-cve-2024-32002/ #securityupdate #vulnerability #opensource #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #DevOps #GitHub #News #Git

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T15:50:58.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Git: Securing Git: Addressing 5 new vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-32002 (9.1 critical) Recursive clones on case-insensitive filesystems that support symlinks are susceptible to Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2024-32004 (8.2 high) Remote Code Execution while cloning special-crafted local repositories
  • CVE-2024-32465 (7.4 high) Protections for cloning untrusted repositories can be bypassed
  • CVE-2024-32020 (3.9 low) Cloning local repository by untrusted user allows the untrusted user to modify objects in the cloned repository at will
  • CVE-2024-32021 (3.9 low) Local clone may hardlink arbitrary user-readable files into the new repository's "objects/" directory

#CVE #Git #vulnerability

CVE-2024-4692

screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T15:12:26.375Z ##

Jenkins: Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-05-24
No mention of exploitation

  • CVE-2024-28793 (8.0 high) Stored XSS vulnerability in Team Concert Git Plugin
  • XXE vulnerabilities in OpenText Application Automation Tools Plugin
    • CVE-2024-4189 (7.1 high) LrScriptResultsParser.java
    • CVE-2024-4184 (7.1 high) XpathReader.java
    • CVE-2024-4690 (7.1 high) others
  • Missing permission checks in OpenText Application Automation Tools Plugin
    • CVE-2024-4211 (4.3 medium) ALM jobs configurations
    • CVE-2024-4691 (4.3 medium) ALM Octane configurations
    • CVE-2024-4692 (4.3 medium) Service Virtualization configurations
  • CVE-2024-5273 (4.3 medium) Path traversal vulnerability in Report Info Plugin

#Jenkins #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability

CVE-2024-29823
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

adulau at 2024-05-24T04:36:26.278Z ##

KB Security Advisory Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM) May 2024

An unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM 2022 SU5 and prior allows an unauthenticated attacker within the same network to execute arbitrary code.

It's actually 10 SQL Injections....

CVE-2024-29822
CVE-2024-29823
CVE-2024-29824
CVE-2024-29825
CVE-2024-29826
CVE-2024-29827

CVE-2024-29828

CVE-2024-29829

CVE-2024-29830

CVE-2024-29846

The good news, it's documented.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-Security-Advisory-EPM-May-2024?language=en_US

#ivanti #vulnerability #vulnerabilities #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-21T17:25:34.318Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory May 2024
16 vulnerabilities across 5 Ivanti products. No exploitation but EVERYTHING is critical and high severity. See related blog post: May Security Update

  • Ivanti Avalanche:
    • CVE-2024-29848 (7.2 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM:
    • CVE-2024-22059 (8.8 high) SQL injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-22060 (8.7 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Connect Secure
    • CVE-2023-38551 (8.2 high) CRLF Injection vulnerability
  • Ivanti Secure Access
    • CVE-2023-38042 (7.8 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
    • CVE-2023-46810 (7.3 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM)
    • CVE-2024-29822 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29823 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29824 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29825 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29826 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29827 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29828 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29829 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29830 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29846 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability

cc: @campuscodi

#Ivanti #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE #ConnectSecure #EPM #Avalanche

Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory May 2024
16 vulnerabilities across 5 Ivanti products. No exploitation but EVERYTHING is critical and high severity. See related blog post: May Security Update

  • Ivanti Avalanche:
    • CVE-2024-29848 (7.2 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM:
    • CVE-2024-22059 (8.8 high) SQL injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-22060 (8.7 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Connect Secure
    • CVE-2023-38551 (8.2 high) CRLF Injection vulnerability
  • Ivanti Secure Access
    • CVE-2023-38042 (7.8 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
    • CVE-2023-46810 (7.3 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM)
    • CVE-2024-29822 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29823 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29824 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29825 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability

CVE-2024-29830

CVE-2024-29846

The good news, it's documented.

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-Security-Advisory-EPM-May-2024?language=en_US

#ivanti #vulnerability #vulnerabilities #infosec

##
jbhall56 at 2024-05-23T12:39:24.469Z ##

Six of the 10 vulnerabilities – from CVE-2024-29822 through CVE-2024-29827 (CVSS scores: 9.6) – relate to SQL injection flaws that allow an unauthenticated attacker within the same network to execute arbitrary code. https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/ivanti-patches-critical-remote-code.html

##
jbhall56 at 2024-05-22T12:21:31.288Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-29822 through CVE-2024-29827, the bugs impact the Core server of Ivanti EPM 2022 SU5 and previous releases, and have a CVSS score of 9.6. https://www.securityweek.com/ivanti-patches-critical-code-execution-vulnerabilities-in-endpoint-manager/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-21T17:25:34.318Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory May 2024
16 vulnerabilities across 5 Ivanti products. No exploitation but EVERYTHING is critical and high severity. See related blog post: May Security Update

  • Ivanti Avalanche:
    • CVE-2024-29848 (7.2 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM:
    • CVE-2024-22059 (8.8 high) SQL injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-22060 (8.7 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Connect Secure
    • CVE-2023-38551 (8.2 high) CRLF Injection vulnerability
  • Ivanti Secure Access
    • CVE-2023-38042 (7.8 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
    • CVE-2023-46810 (7.3 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM)
    • CVE-2024-29822 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29823 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29824 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability

    • CVE-2024-29827 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29828 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability

    • CVE-2024-29830 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29846 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability

##
jbhall56 at 2024-05-23T12:39:24.469Z ##

Six of the 10 vulnerabilities – from CVE-2024-29822 through CVE-2024-29827 (CVSS scores: 9.6) – relate to SQL injection flaws that allow an unauthenticated attacker within the same network to execute arbitrary code. https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/ivanti-patches-critical-remote-code.html

##
jbhall56 at 2024-05-22T12:21:31.288Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-29822 through CVE-2024-29827, the bugs impact the Core server of Ivanti EPM 2022 SU5 and previous releases, and have a CVSS score of 9.6. https://www.securityweek.com/ivanti-patches-critical-code-execution-vulnerabilities-in-endpoint-manager/

screaminggoat at 2024-05-18T12:10:16.073Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC): CVE-2024-30056 - Security Update Guide
This one slipped through the cracks: CVE-2024-30056 (7.1 high)
Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability. Weakness: CWE-359: Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor. The 3 FAQ answers provide context as to how to exploit the vulnerability. Not publicly disclosed, not exploited, exploitation less likely.

#MSRC #CVE_2024_30056 #Edge #Chrome #Chromium #vulnerability #CVE

alienghic@octodon.social at 2024-05-16T20:10:33.000Z ##

Bug in #Debian for tracking the recent #git vulnerabilities, which links to the specific Debian #CVE security tracker records.

Currently "vulnerable" hopefully there'll be some progress soon.

https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=1071160

https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-32002
https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-32004

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T15:50:58.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Git: Securing Git: Addressing 5 new vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-32002 (9.1 critical) Recursive clones on case-insensitive filesystems that support symlinks are susceptible to Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2024-32004 (8.2 high) Remote Code Execution while cloning special-crafted local repositories
  • CVE-2024-32465 (7.4 high) Protections for cloning untrusted repositories can be bypassed
  • CVE-2024-32020 (3.9 low) Cloning local repository by untrusted user allows the untrusted user to modify objects in the cloned repository at will
  • CVE-2024-32021 (3.9 low) Local clone may hardlink arbitrary user-readable files into the new repository's "objects/" directory

#CVE #Git #vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T15:50:58.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Git: Securing Git: Addressing 5 new vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-32002 (9.1 critical) Recursive clones on case-insensitive filesystems that support symlinks are susceptible to Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2024-32004 (8.2 high) Remote Code Execution while cloning special-crafted local repositories
  • CVE-2024-32465 (7.4 high) Protections for cloning untrusted repositories can be bypassed
  • CVE-2024-32020 (3.9 low) Cloning local repository by untrusted user allows the untrusted user to modify objects in the cloned repository at will
  • CVE-2024-32021 (3.9 low) Local clone may hardlink arbitrary user-readable files into the new repository's "objects/" directory

#CVE #Git #vulnerability

##
cadey@pony.social at 2024-05-15T01:11:09.000Z ##

We would like to extend our sincerest apologies for mistakenly categorizing CVE-2024-32004 as a memory safety vulnerability. This incorrect assumption has caused unnecessary concern and anxiety among our stakeholders, and for that, we are truly sorry.

In reality, the vulnerability in question was a logic error within Git, rather than a memory safety issue. We understand that this distinction is crucial, as it impacts the severity of the vulnerability and the necessary mitigation steps. Unfortunately, our initial assessment was inaccurate, and we fell short of providing the level of clarity and precision that you expect from us.

We are taking immediate action to rectify this mistake and prevent similar errors from occurring in the future. We are implementing additional checks and validation processes to ensure that our vulnerability assessments are accurate and reliable. This includes augmenting our team with subject matter experts, enhancing our testing procedures, and incorporating machine learning algorithms to detect potential issues more effectively.

We want to assure you that we are committed to regaining your trust by consistently delivering high-quality services. We recognize the importance of transparency and communication in maintaining a strong relationship with our stakeholders. Going forward, we will strive to provide accurate and timely information about vulnerabilities, ensuring that our assessments align with industry standards and best practices.

Once again, we apologize for any inconvenience or concern caused by our initial mistake. We are dedicated to continuous improvement and learning from this experience to become an even more reliable and trustworthy partner in the security community.

##
cadey@pony.social at 2024-05-15T00:44:14.000Z ##

[RETRACTED] "No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens

https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2024-32004/

This isn't memory safety. I misread the CVE details. I fucked up.

##

alienghic@octodon.social at 2024-05-16T20:10:33.000Z ##

Bug in #Debian for tracking the recent #git vulnerabilities, which links to the specific Debian #CVE security tracker records.

Currently "vulnerable" hopefully there'll be some progress soon.

https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=1071160

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T15:50:58.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Git: Securing Git: Addressing 5 new vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-32002 (9.1 critical) Recursive clones on case-insensitive filesystems that support symlinks are susceptible to Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2024-32004 (8.2 high) Remote Code Execution while cloning special-crafted local repositories
  • CVE-2024-32465 (7.4 high) Protections for cloning untrusted repositories can be bypassed
  • CVE-2024-32020 (3.9 low) Cloning local repository by untrusted user allows the untrusted user to modify objects in the cloned repository at will
  • CVE-2024-32021 (3.9 low) Local clone may hardlink arbitrary user-readable files into the new repository's "objects/" directory

#CVE #Git #vulnerability

CVE-2024-23667
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

1 posts

N/A

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T19:07:45.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet: 21 new vulnerabilities (no mention of exploitation) across 18 advisories:

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put
  • FG-IR-23-433 CVE-2023-50180 (5.5 medium) Exposure of password hashes to read-only admin
  • FG-IR-23-137 Format String Bug in cli command
    • CVE-2023-36640 (6.7 medium)
    • CVE-2023-45583 (6.7 medium)
  • FG-IR-23-465 CVE-2024-23664 (6.1 medium) FortiAuthenticator - Open Redirect on /portal/disclaimer
  • FG-IR-24-120 HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Frames Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-27316 for Apache HTTP Server (httpd)
    • CVE-2024-24549 for Apache Tomcat
    • CVE-2024-30255 for Envoy proxy (nghttp2)
    • CVE-2023-45288 for Golang
    • CVE-2024-28182 for nghttp2
    • CVE-2024-27983 for Node.js
    • CVE-2024-3302 for Firefox
  • FG-IR-23-282 CVE-2023-40720 (7.1 high) IDOR over SIP configuration file
  • FG-IR-24-052 CVE-2024-31493 (6.5 medium) Information disclosure in content hub
  • FG-IR-23-222 Multiple improper input validation and authorization vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-23667 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23668 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23669 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23670 (8.8 high)
  • FG-IR-24-017 CVE-2024-26007 (5.3 medium) Node.js crash over administrative interface
  • FG-IR-23-191 CVE-2024-23107 (5.5 medium) Read only administrator can see passwords' hashes
  • FG-IR-24-054 CVE-2024-31491 (8.8 high) Readonly user could execute sensitive operations
  • FG-IR-23-225 CVE-2023-45586 (5.0 medium) SSL-VPN user IP spoofing
  • FG-IR-24-040 CVE-2024-31488 (6.8 medium) Stored and reflected XSS
  • FG-IR-23-474 CVE-2024-23665 (5.9 medium) Unauthorized ADOM operations

#Fortinet #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #FortiOS #HTTP2 #ContinuationFlood

##

CVE-2024-21760
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

1 posts

N/A

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T19:07:45.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet: 21 new vulnerabilities (no mention of exploitation) across 18 advisories:

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put
  • FG-IR-23-433 CVE-2023-50180 (5.5 medium) Exposure of password hashes to read-only admin
  • FG-IR-23-137 Format String Bug in cli command
    • CVE-2023-36640 (6.7 medium)
    • CVE-2023-45583 (6.7 medium)
  • FG-IR-23-465 CVE-2024-23664 (6.1 medium) FortiAuthenticator - Open Redirect on /portal/disclaimer
  • FG-IR-24-120 HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Frames Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-27316 for Apache HTTP Server (httpd)
    • CVE-2024-24549 for Apache Tomcat
    • CVE-2024-30255 for Envoy proxy (nghttp2)
    • CVE-2023-45288 for Golang
    • CVE-2024-28182 for nghttp2
    • CVE-2024-27983 for Node.js
    • CVE-2024-3302 for Firefox
  • FG-IR-23-282 CVE-2023-40720 (7.1 high) IDOR over SIP configuration file
  • FG-IR-24-052 CVE-2024-31493 (6.5 medium) Information disclosure in content hub
  • FG-IR-23-222 Multiple improper input validation and authorization vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-23667 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23668 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23669 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23670 (8.8 high)
  • FG-IR-24-017 CVE-2024-26007 (5.3 medium) Node.js crash over administrative interface
  • FG-IR-23-191 CVE-2024-23107 (5.5 medium) Read only administrator can see passwords' hashes
  • FG-IR-24-054 CVE-2024-31491 (8.8 high) Readonly user could execute sensitive operations
  • FG-IR-23-225 CVE-2023-45586 (5.0 medium) SSL-VPN user IP spoofing
  • FG-IR-24-040 CVE-2024-31488 (6.8 medium) Stored and reflected XSS
  • FG-IR-23-474 CVE-2024-23665 (5.9 medium) Unauthorized ADOM operations

#Fortinet #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #FortiOS #HTTP2 #ContinuationFlood

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet: 21 new vulnerabilities (no mention of exploitation) across 18 advisories:

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put
  • FG-IR-23-433 CVE-2023-50180 (5.5 medium) Exposure of password hashes to read-only admin

    • CVE-2023-45583 (6.7 medium)
  • FG-IR-23-465 CVE-2024-23664 (6.1 medium) FortiAuthenticator - Open Redirect on /portal/disclaimer

    • CVE-2024-27316 for Apache HTTP Server (httpd)
    • CVE-2024-24549 for Apache Tomcat
    • CVE-2024-30255 for Envoy proxy (nghttp2)
    • CVE-2023-45288 for Golang
    • CVE-2024-28182 for nghttp2
    • CVE-2024-27983 for Node.js
    • CVE-2024-3302 for Firefox
  • FG-IR-23-282 CVE-2023-40720 (7.1 high) IDOR over SIP configuration file
  • FG-IR-24-052 CVE-2024-31493 (6.5 medium) Information disclosure in content hub
  • FG-IR-23-222 Multiple improper input validation and authorization vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-23667 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23668 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23669 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23670 (8.8 high)

  • FG-IR-23-191 CVE-2024-23107 (5.5 medium) Read only administrator can see passwords' hashes

  • FG-IR-23-225 CVE-2023-45586 (5.0 medium) SSL-VPN user IP spoofing

  • FG-IR-23-474 CVE-2024-23665 (5.9 medium) Unauthorized ADOM operations

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T19:07:45.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet: 21 new vulnerabilities (no mention of exploitation) across 18 advisories:

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put

    • CVE-2023-36640 (6.7 medium)
    • CVE-2023-45583 (6.7 medium)
  • FG-IR-23-465 CVE-2024-23664 (6.1 medium) FortiAuthenticator - Open Redirect on /portal/disclaimer

    • CVE-2024-27983 for Node.js
    • CVE-2024-3302 for Firefox

  • FG-IR-24-052 CVE-2024-31493 (6.5 medium) Information disclosure in content hub
  • FG-IR-23-222 Multiple improper input validation and authorization vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-23667 (8.8 high)
